mnemonic: George Bush, the American emperor, our white king, was fond of COCAINE.

jukugo.meaning: emperor of Japan - never used about other countries. (BOOBOO: you don't say 天皇さん！　And you don't use his proper name - Hirohito or Akihito, either. You say, 天皇陛下　（てんのう　へいか) which means His Majesty The Emperor. If you want an easy-to-read book that really dishes all the dirt on the Emperor system, read YAMATO DYNASTY by Sterling Seagrave.

pet owner

mnemonic: FOXES ( = きつね) stop at the coffee-shop to get their drink on.
I got a contract to enjoy a drink and smoke with my mouth every time I go to that cafe .

jukugo.word: 喫茶店 ( きっさてん )
jukugo.meaning: a coffee-shop. These are really popular because Japanese don't invite people over to their homes very often - they meet at the coffee-shop. This is fairly polite example to point to when a Japanese asks you, "Do foreigners really think we're a cold people?" BOOBOO: most Japanese don't say きっさてん。 they just say 喫茶、(きっさ)。

The honorable person enjoys a drink of KETCHUP or water instead of booze.

kunyomi.meaning: honorable - unlike the related term 名誉 （めいよ）　潔さ happens even if no one is looking. 潔さ means someone who puts principle above everything else - someone who will turn down a job offer from a mob-connected business, even if they are really broke and don't have enough to eat. This is also the word used about guys who commit suicide for honor. (CCW)
honor

mnemonic: That GUY punched the master right in the fucking mouth, damaging his crown in the process.

jukugo.meaning: pollution. Has a more broad meaning than the related word 汚染（おせん）。 Not just dirty smoggy air, but also noise pollution, the annoyance of someone talking on a cellphone on a train, and 情報公害　（じょうほうこうがい）: "ad pollution" - the inescapable advertisements one sees everywhere. BOOBOO:If you want to say "environmental pollution," you have to use 汚染、　not 公害。

jukugo.meaning: damage (to property) or casualties (human): used about earthquakes, wars, and crimes.

mnemonic: He damaged the CAT with the sword, dividing it in two.

kunyomi.meaning: I divide it- also can mean 'smash a brittle object to pieces' like if you drop a mirror.
it divides / it gets divided

description: 割 (divide) + 引 (pull) = 割引 (discount)

jukugo.meaning: role, but more general and figurative than just 役（やく）。 Gay dudes who are top or bottom - that's 役割。 If your role is 'the black sheep of the family," that's 役割。 The guy in the boy-band who is "the edgy one." The person on the reality -tv show who is "the crazy one."
description: The verb is 果たす（はたす）, as in XXX　の役割を果たす（ to play the role of XXX) (KUNKUN)
役 (role) + 割 (divide) = 役割 (role)
一 (one) + 割 (divide) = 一割 (10 percent)
割 (divide) + 合 (to suit) = 割合 (ratio)

description: 素 (element) + 晴 (weather get good now) = 素晴らしい (the best!)

To give birth. Can be used figuratively as in, "these conditions breed terrorists," or "He gave birth to the film industry," or " produce profits."
to live.

usually means, "make the most of (a resource or a spot of good luck)" or　"to use wisely. (a scarce resource)" . . . but but it also can mean a doctor literally bringing a patient back to live i.e. after cardiac arrest.
sprout (hairs as well as plants)

description: 先 (earlier/ the tip) + 生 (life / birth) = 先生 (teacher)
生 (life / birth) + 活 (vivid, lively) = 生活 (lifestyle)
学 (knowledge) + 生 (life / birth) = 学生 (student)

jukugo.meaning: this is hard. It got tons of meanings: nama tv is live, not prerecorded. Nama beer is poured straight from the bottle, not like a fancy mixed drink. Nama information is first hand. Nama meat is raw. (PRE)
Life, as in someone's entire life, or life in general:. "He lived a quiet life." "Life is a bitch." "Life span."
description: 人 (person) + 生 (life / birth) = 人生 (life (in general))

jukugo.meaning: living, moving thing . . . (BOOBOO：it doesn't apply to plants! Only little dudes that can move around and forage for food are いきもの)
description: 生 (life / birth) + 物 (animal / thing) = 生き物 (living thing)

図 (diagram/ map) + 星 (star) = 図星 (bullseye.)

jukugo.word: 可能性 の or が ( かのうせい の or が)

jukugo.meaning: female - emphasizes biology, (sex, rather than gender).
description: 女 (woman) + 性 (sex / essential nature) = 女性 (female)
男 (man) + 性 (sex / essential nature) = 男性 (male)

jukugo.meaning: SUFFIX which turns an adjective into a noun: possible+性=possibility. creative+性=creativity. 男性　＝ man, but 男性性＝ masculinity. (SUF)
what you got from your pops.
description: 性 (sex / essential nature) + 病 (sick kanji) = 性病 (STD)

朱 (vermilion) + 色 (color) = 朱色 (vermilion)

jukugo.meaning: the coast OR the beach! Unlike 浜辺 or 浜, 海岸 has a scientific meaning: the coastline, (regardless of if there's sand or not). You'll see 海岸 on maps or geography books. The useage of 海岸 is odd, even for Japanese. Where Americans will just say, "Let's go to the beach!", Japanese might suggest to their pals, "海へ行こう！”（let's go to the ocean!) but ONLY ONCE THEY WERE ALREADY THERE, then they might specifically suggest going to the 海岸 - as opposed to other things to do by the sea. Weird!

jukugo.word: 耐久性 ( たいきゅうせい )

mnemonic: MUTANTS:
Each
eachbottom
Each bird in the nest loves the guy with the moustache from the bottom of its heart. (he feeds them worms, and if that isn't what love is all about, I'll eat my hat)

If there's an article in a womens' magazine, "How to get love in 10 steps!" it'll be using 恋愛. But you wouldn't tell a hot guy " I 恋愛 you very much!" See?

jukugo.meaning: affection : more than friendship and less than love.
description: 愛 (love) + 情 (emotion) = 愛情 (affection : more than friendship and less than love.)

kunyomi.word: ( お ) きゃく ( さん or さま )

観 (point of view) + 客 (customer) = 観客 (audience)

jukugo.word: 乗客 ( じょうきゃく )

description: 落 (fall,drop) + 着 (wear / arrive) = 落ち着く (keep your cool.)

jukugo.word: 堕落 してる ( だらく してる)
jukugo.meaning: corrupt in one's personal life - not usually political corruption. Drugs, lies, trife behavior.
description: 堕 (corrupt) + 落 (fall,drop) = 堕落 (corrupt)

jukugo.word: 部落民 ( ぶらくみん )
jukugo.meaning: (literally,'the fallen group.') this is - along with Ainu, Korean ex-slaves, the Eta-hin,and the handicapped, one of the main groups discriminated against in Japan. I won't go into the whole story here, but most Japanese will say, 'Don't say ぶらくみん, it's 差別 (さべつ＝ discriminatory)' What they neglect to tell you is, there is no polite word! Effectively denying these people a voice in the guise of being polite to them. This is a very. Very. Japanese way of fucking with people. (CCW, ABU, FR)
description: 部 (section) + 落 (fall,drop) + 民 (folk) = 部落民 (burakumin)

jukugo.word: 落第 する ( らくだい する)
jukugo.meaning: fail an exam,or get held back a grade.
description: 落 (fall,drop) + 第 (rank or number in series) = 落第 (fail a test)

mnemonic: You should judge a man's character by the size of his COCK.

jukugo.meaning: literally, 'look' or 'shape,' as in 'He's dressed as a woman' : おんなの格好してる。
description: But　usually it means 'coolness:' かっこいい (cool) or かっこうわるい (not).(when used in the figurative, 'cool' sense, it is usually KANA) (1/2 KANA)
格 (character, aspect) + 好 (like) = 格好 (looks)
性 (sex / essential nature) + 格 (character, aspect) = 性格 (personality)

jukugo.word: 合格 する ( ごうかく する)

jukugo.word: 連絡 する ( れんらく する)
jukugo.meaning: to inform, to let someone know. Like, "Let me know if you're coming. Call me when you get there," kind of thing.
description: 連 (take with / inform of) + 絡 (get entangled) = 連絡 (inform)

mnemonic: r.y.a.k.u. is an abbreviation for each field. (Rrice Yells And Kalls U!)

kunyomi.meaning: to omit some information. Usually used like :　りゃくして： "I won't mention in more detail because you already know this part." Or, alternatively:

jukugo.word: 省略 する ( しょうりゃく する)
jukugo.meaning: ｔｏ　ａｂｂｒｅｖｉａｔｅ, omit, but also contraction. ( contractions like 'ain't' are 省略）

description: 条 (clause) + 件 (incident) = 条件 (condition)

jukugo.meaning: article 9 of the constitution, which states that Japan can't have an army. Right? WRONG. Japan CAN have an army - they just aren't allowed to invade, an inconvinient fact that both pacifists AND right-wingers seem to forget.

description: this can mean wheat, barley, or even oats.

description: 小 (small size) + 麦 (barley) + 粉 (powder) = 小麦粉 (flour)

kunyomi.meaning: Treatment - usually applied to people, but originally used for objects, so it 's a little rude. Usually used like あつかいがいい or あつかいがわるい. Can mean 'treatment of others' but, confusingly, can ALSO mean 'easy or hard for ME to DEAL WITH HIM/HER.' For example, 彼は扱いが難しい does NOT mean 'He treats me difficultly', it means 'He's difficult to deal with.' (noun)
treatment(verb)

If you're talking about intrusive, anxious thoughts that make it impossible to enjoy a sunny day, or whether you're talking about a burglar intruding into your home, or an infestation of maggots in a wound, or even if you're planning a particular point for a moon landing, しんにゅう is your boy. Holla! (NP)

to hit (the nail on the head), to correspond to something exactly.To win (a prize)

jukugo.word: 本当 に ( ほんとう に)
description: 本 (book / the real) + 当 (hit the target) = 本当 (for realz.)

jukugo.meaning: appropriate, as in an appropriate gift. However, 適当　also means irresponsible! Doing something without considering the consequences. 適当な人間だ！ “He's irresponsible. He'll say anything that pops into his head.” (JERK)

夫 (husband) + 婦 (housewife) = 夫婦 (married couple)
主 (master/mainly) + 婦 (housewife) = 主婦 (housewife)
妊 (pregnant) + 婦 (housewife) = 妊婦 (pregnant woman)

thus:
I got my sword pointed at your ugly snout, and my dagger pointed at your ugly hat, you need to get your ass home before I kill you!!!

jukugo.word: 我慢 する ( がまん する)
jukugo.meaning: to endure, to bear something. Often translated as 'patience,' but that is not quite right. You have patience if you can do data entry on a fucking kanji dictionary for 5 hours straight, but you gaman with your overtime or while taking final exams with a burst appendix.
description: Masochists tend to gaman when they're fed worms while tied up.
Sometimes the concept of gaman DOES overlap with the English idea of patience, though: Little kids have to gaman if they find out that Disneyland is still 4 hours away.

One possible way to make GAMAN fit with the theme of 'neglect' is to remember that the 'ga' part means 'self.' So GAMAN means 'neglect yourself,' or, more poetically, 'Stop feeling the pain of your body and mind, and concentrate on the task at hand.' (CCW, 1/2 KANA)
我 (we) + 慢 (neglect/ egotistic) = 我慢 (persevere)

kunyomi.meaning: 4 things (COUNTER)

description: 四 (the numeral 4) + 月 (moon) = 四月 (April)
四 (the numeral 4) + 時 (time) = 四時 (4 o'clock)

jukugo.meaning: 4 hours' time. As in, this bus ride takes 4 hours.
description: 四時 (4 o'clock) + 間 (a period of time) = 四時間 (4 hours' time)
四 (the numeral 4) + 日 (sun, day) = 四日 (fourth day of the month )
四 (the numeral 4) + 角 (horn/corner) = 四角 (a square)

mnemonic: When Genghis KHAN puts four big fish-hooks in your mouth, you'll exclaim too.

kunyomi.meaning: (almost always hiragana) - yell in an angry way, but you're still using words. (KANA)

mnemonic: I CAN exchange my hand for four big fish hooks (FYI I am some kind of rejected Bond villain)

kunyomi.meaning: exchange (yen for euros) change (diapers / a broken heel on your pumps) Unlike the other かえる　(替える）、 換える means you are exchanging something for a similar or identical thing

jukugo.word: 交換 する ( こうかん する)
jukugo.meaning: swap, exchange (Japanese/English language exchange, for instance)
description: 交 (combine) + 換 (exchange) = 交換 (exchange)

jukugo.word: に 乗り換える (に のりかえる )
description: 乗 (ride a vehicle) + 換 (exchange) = 乗り換える (transfer)
換 (exchange) + 気 (mood) = 換気 (ventilation)

mnemonic: I lack KETCHUP. please pass it over here.
Unlike the regular rifle radical, the tip on the right hangs limply down.
You could say that the person LACKS a functioning rifle. And then you could giggle about that if you were, you know, immatoor.

kunyomi.meaning: to lack an abstract thing (experience / confidence / creativity / trust) （BOOBOO: if you want to say you don't have enough of a physical thing (for instance, money!) you'd say 足りない (たりない）instead.)

jukugo.word: 欠点 がある / 　がない ( けってん がある / 　がない)
jukugo.meaning: shortcoming. Opposite of 長所（ちょうしょ）. Can be used about people (he drinks too much, she always lies) or machines (this PC is very slow and prone to crashing).
description: 欠 (lack) + 点 (point) = 欠点 (shortcoming)

jukugo.word: 欠陥 のある ( けっかん のある)
description: 欠 (lack) + 陥 (entrapped) = 欠陥 (defective)

jukugo.word: 欠席 する ( けっせき する)
jukugo.meaning: A kind of formal word for failure to attend, absence. (F)
description: 欠 (lack) + 席 (seat) = 欠席 (absent)

mnemonic: OH shit! Europe lacks a single ward without bad techno!!

jukugo.meaning: Europe and USA - but unfortunately due to racism, Japanese often use 欧米 to mean the West in general, ignoring Africa, South and Latin America and even Canada.
description: 欧 (Europe) + 米 (rice / America) = 欧米 (europe/ USA)

mnemonic: Personally, I like to sing in my CAR, so others can't hear me.
It's possible to sing even if you lack talent.

kunyomi.meaning: song (BOOBOO: 歌 is generally used only for songs with lyrics. Instrumentals are きょく　（曲）

jukugo.meaning: singer. Not like Joey Ramone, but like Celine Fuckin' Dion or Pavarotti or someone.
description: 歌 (sing) + 手 (hand) = 歌手 (singer)
歌 (sing) + 詞 (part of speech) = 歌詞 (lyrics)

jukugo.word: 主題歌 ( しゅだいか )
description: 主 (master/mainly) + 題 (topic) + 歌 (sing) = 主題歌 (theme song)

mnemonic: When your mom blows out her mouth, I can tell her breath lacks SWEETness. It smells like she swallowed a junkie whole, in fact.

kunyomi.meaning: blow (1/2 KANA)

jukugo.word: 口笛を吹く ( くちぶえをふく )
description: 口 (mouth) + 吹 (blow) = 口笛を吹く (to whistle )

mnemonic: My electric rice cooker makes SWEET rice just fine, even though it lacks a flame.

kunyomi.meaning: boil (anything) / cook (rice)

jukugo.word: 炊飯器 ( すいはんき )
description: 炊 (cook rice) + 飯 (rice / meal) + 器 (instrument) = 炊飯器 (rice-cooker)

Helsig calls this incredibly common radical the TASKMASTER, because it usually shows up in kanji about learning or organized procedures.That makes sense, but I prefer to call him the DIRECTOR, as you can easily picture his imperious figure sitting on this cliche Hollywood director's chair with the crossed legs:

mnemonic: The director makes SUE (a woman) count all the damn rice, until she knows the exact number of kernels.

kunyomi.meaning: a number
to count

jukugo.word: 多数 の xxx ( たすう の xxx)
description: 多 (many) + 数 (number, to count) = 多数 (a big number of XXX)
数 (number, to count) + 字 (letter) = 数字 (a numeral - 1,2,3, etc.)
数 (number, to count) + 学 (knowledge) = 数学 (mathematics)
少 (a little (amount)) + 数 (number, to count) = 少数 (minority)

mnemonic: MY tree fell down and flattened the director. It was an accident, I swear!

jukugo.meaning: counter for flat objects (ichimai, nimai, sanmai, yonmai, etc.) (COUNTER)

description: 何 (what?!?) + 枚 (counter for flat objects) = 何枚 (how many flat objects?)

mnemonic: as in, "BIN Laden must be quick-witted because we still haven't caught him yet."
Every director has to be quick-witted if they want to survive in Hollywood (or Bollywood!)
description: This kanji applies to both physical agility, and mental quick-wittedness. AND it means 'sensitive' as well. Jerk!!!

jukugo.word: 敏感 である or な ( びんかん である or な)
jukugo.meaning: sensitive (in both the good and bad sense)
description: 敏 (agile / sensitive) + 感 (feeling) = 敏感 (sensitive)

jukugo.word: 鋭敏 な ( えいびん な)
description: 鋭 (sharp) + 敏 (agile / sensitive) = 鋭敏 (quick-witted, keen.)

jukugo.word: 過敏 な ( かびん な)
description: 過 (surpass / too much) + 敏 (agile / sensitive) = 過敏 (hypersensitive)

mnemonic: Are you a loser ? HAI!
The director defeated me and stole my money!

kunyomi.word: ( で or に ) やぶ＊れる
kunyomi.meaning: to be beaten

jukugo.word: 失敗 する ( しっぱい する)
jukugo.meaning: any failure! Flunking a test, your plan fails, no one comes to your party, your business goes bankrupt, your mom's chest waxing goes wrong and her pec-fro winds up as Beyonce's wig.
description: 失 (miss out on) + 敗 (be defeated) = 失敗 (failure)

jukugo.word: 大失敗 ( だいしっぱい )
description: 大 (big) + 失敗 (any failure! Flunking a test, your plan fails, no one comes to your party, your business goes bankrupt, your mom's chest waxing goes wrong and her pec-fro winds up as Beyonce's wig.) = 大失敗 (total disaster)

mnemonic: Don't let the KODOMO (子)have an accident if you are the babysitter.
The director is so old, he keeps having accidents on set.

kunyomi.word: ゆえ ( に　 or ある or　ない )
kunyomi.meaning: reason

jukugo.meaning: accident - not like you spilled your Coke, but like a traffic accident or a dude getting smeared by a meteorite.
description: 事 (action/ incident) + 故 (breakdown, accident) = 事故 (accident)

jukugo.meaning: a slightly more emphatic version of "Why?" (1/2 KANA)
description: 何 (what?!?) + 故 (breakdown, accident) = 何故 (why)
故 (breakdown, accident) + 障 (impede) = 故障 (malfunction)

mnemonic: Politicians are like benevolent directors that SAY laws which are correct. That's why there are no problems in the world today.
description: FR, if you are cynical!
政 (politics) + 府 (government) = 政府 (government)

jukugo.meaning: politics. (FR：literally "administer and cure",which is a bit of a laugh) (FR)
description: 政 (politics) + 治 (cure) = 政治 (politics)
政 (politics) + 策 (take measures) = 政策 (a policy)

mnemonic: The director commands you: Release the HOE in that direction. Her radio collar will provide valuable information about her movements and migrations.

kunyomi.meaning: I release it
it is released

jukugo.word: 放送 する ( ほうそう する)
description: 放 (release) + 送 (send) = 放送 (broadcast)

jukugo.word: 食べ放題 ( たべほうだい )
description: 食 (eat) + 放 (release) + 題 (topic) = 食べ放題 (all you can eat )

jukugo.word: 飲み放題 ( のみほうだい )
description: 飲 (drink) + 放 (release) + 題 (topic) = 飲み放題 (all you can drink)

jukugo.word: 開放 する ( かいほう する)
description: 開 (open) + 放 (release) = 開放 (emancipate, let loose )

mnemonic: TODAY(今日, pronounced KYOU) , I taught my little brother how to blow snot out of one nostril, all "farmer style."
The director is teaching the children so much their heads get dizzy.

kunyomi.meaning: to teach

jukugo.word: 教科書 ( きょうかしょ )
description: 教 (teach) + 科 (science) + 書 (write) = 教科書 (textbook)
教 (teach) + 室 (room) = 教室 (classroom)
教 (teach) + 育 (grow up / be raised) = 教育 (education)
教 (teach) + 会 (big meeting) = 教会 (church)

mnemonic: If the movie is intense so I GET KEYED up and start yelling at the screen.
The wet, white-capped, intense waves were heading in the direction of the director!!

kunyomi.meaning: severe, violent, intense　Has the nuance of something that is aggressive and over-full of energy: weather, emotions, or even a place that is crazy packed and busy can be hageshii.

jukugo.word: 刺激 する ( しげき する)
jukugo.meaning: stimulate something - a chemical reaction, a clitoris, whatever. (v) ;a stimulus (n)
description: 刺 (stab / buisness card) + 激 (intense) = 刺激 (stimulate)

jukugo.word: 激励 する ( げきれい する)
description: 激 (intense) + 励 (diligence) = 激励 (encouragement, incitement )

mnemonic: Could you give me a HAND with this reproduction?
People reproduce by sperm which resembles a kind of agile string.

jukugo.word: 頻繁 に ( ひんぱん に)

jukugo.meaning: breeding. Unlike the related term 生殖 （せいしょく）、繁殖 refers to the entire process of finding a mate, not just the physical act of insemination: Breeding grounds. Mating season. Farmers breeding livestock.
description: 繁 (reproduction) + 殖 (multiply) = 繁殖 (breeding)

mnemonic: COLIN Powell was the director of the army because his attacks were so crafty.

kunyomi.meaning: attack - specifically, something which has been planned in advance. Not a bar-room brawl. You could use it about an army attack, but also about a fencer who deliberately chooses a certain attack-style to defeat her opponent.

jukugo.word: 攻撃 する ( こうげき する)
description: 攻 (attack) + 撃 (charge) = 攻撃 (attack)
専 (specialty) + 攻 (attack) = 専攻 (major)

jukugo.word: に 侵攻 する (に しんこう する)
description: 侵 (perpetrate) + 攻 (attack) = 侵攻 (invasion)

mnemonic: 立 (stand up) + 古 (old) + Inside (George Michael's Moustache)
description: You can think of him as an old man with a huge moustache who stands up whenever a varmint encroaches on his mud-flap.

mnemonic: Bugs Bunny was the ENEMY of Yosemite Sam. (as was the director of the cartoon, which is why Sam always lost!)

kunyomi.meaning: enemy (LAZY)
to be a match for someone / to be up to a task

jukugo.meaning: Wonderful! Magnificent! This is usually used only by women, and it is used in reference to things made or done by a third party - you wouldn't say your friend's cooking was すてき, but you'd say a dress your friend wore was すてき.
description: 素 (element) + 敵 (enemy) = 素敵 (Wonderful!)

jukugo.word: 無敵 な ( むてき な)
description: 無 (without) + 敵 (enemy) = 無敵 (unrivaled)
敵 (enemy) + 対 (against) = 敵対 (rival)

mnemonic: My TEKI (enemy) is suitable for poking or slapping.
Yosemite Sam is very suitable for the mud-flaps of a moving vehicle.

jukugo.word: 適当 な ( てきとう な)
jukugo.meaning: appropriate, as in an appropriate gift. However, 適当　also means irresponsible! Doing something without considering the consequences. 適当な人間だ！ “He's irresponsible. He'll say anything that pops into his head.” (JERK)
description: 適 (suitable) + 当 (hit the target) = 適当 (appropriate)

jukugo.word: 適齢期 ( てきれいき )
description: 適 (suitable) + 齢 (stage of life) + 期 (period of time) = 適齢期 (a marriageable age)

mnemonic: Water drops are the ENEMY of electricity.
Water drops make Yosemite Sam's hat grow limp.

kunyomi.meaning: to drip

description: 水 (water) + 滴 (drop) = 水滴 (drop of water)

mnemonic: Yosemite Sam's hands pluck his prodigious Moustache.

kunyomi.meaning: literally, to prune - the gardener prunes the bushes.

kunyomi.word: It's often used in the phrase 才能を摘む (sainou wo tsumu,to stunt the emotional growth of your kids).(BOOBOO: plucking a single flower is ぬく, not つむ）
指摘 する ( してき する)
kunyomi.meaning: To point out a shortcoming - You can use it about your friends. Or "The critic pointed out the shortcomings of the play."

mnemonic: The sound of the word KO makes you think of kodomo(子), and 己 looks like a snake, so you could say:
I myself, am a baby snake.
description: Although the onyomi for this is KO, it is STRONG FOR 'KI', - which is to say, most of the kanji using this as a radical have the onyomi of KI for some reason!

kunyomi.meaning: myself- a very LITERARY way of saying 私 (F)

jukugo.word: 自己紹介 ( じこしょうかい )
description: 自己 (One's own (as in, self-control, self-hate, self-help books, one's own discretion) ) + 紹介 (introduce (someone or something to somebody else)) = 自己紹介 (introduce yourself to a group.)

jukugo.meaning: One's own (as in, self-control, self-hate, self-help books, one's own discretion)
description: 自 (my own) + 己 (myself) = 自己 (one's own)

mnemonic: I myself, improve my KITE by adding more streamers.
I, the director, improve myself.

kunyomi.meaning: change PLUS improvement. Usually used with behavior - meaning to turn over a new leaf, to quit self-destructive or bad behavior. Also has a totally unrelated meaning: When a customs official or police asks to see your ID card, that's also 改める for some reason. (1/2 KANA)
something is renewed, reformed (1/2 KANA)

jukugo.meaning: remodeling, renewal, or reorganization　of a physical thing ; re-modeling a house, tricking out a car, re-organizing the leadership of an organization.
description: 改 (renew / improve) + 造 (produce) = 改造 (remodeling, renewal)

jukugo.word: 改善 する ( かいぜん する)
jukugo.meaning: improve a thing - your performance in Math class / the economy / the efficiency of the car
description: 改 (renew / improve) + 善 (morally good) = 改善 (improve)

jukugo.word: 改革 する ( かいかく する)
jukugo.meaning: reform (the welfare system, the campaign-contributions laws, etc.)
description: 改 (renew / improve) + 革 (leather/revolution) = 改革 (reform)

mnemonic: Myself, I go running as soon as I wake up. It's the KEY to good health.

kunyomi.meaning: to wake up
to wake someone up
to occur, to result. Usually said about a new problem or phenomenon.

jukugo.word: 縁起 のいい or の悪い ( えんぎ のいい or の悪い)
jukugo.meaning: an omen (can be good or bad)
description: 縁 (rim / omen) + 起 (wake up / occur) = 縁起 (omen)

mnemonic: You stupid religious nut, why do you KEEP doing the same shit from 10 centuries ago?
The customs and beliefs of previous centuries are connected to myself by the string of time.

description: 世 (society) + 紀 (century) = 世紀 (century)

mnemonic: Saying things to yourself honestly is the KEY to a successful diary.

jukugo.meaning: a record (like the minutes of a meeting or a log-file), but also a record like Guiness' Book. To break a record, like your Moms did at the Special Olympics, is 記録を破る　（きろくをやぶる）.
description: 記 (diary) + 録 (record) = 記録 (record)
日 (sun, day) + 記 (diary) = 日記 (diary)
記 (diary) + 者 (professional) = 記者 (reporter)

jukugo.meaning: a memorial, an anniversary of something good , like marriage or a band's anniversary gig. Or something you give your friend to remember you by.
description: 記 (diary) + 念 (concern) = 記念 (memorial)

mnemonic: Can I myself distribute sake to everyone in the room? HAI!

kunyomi.meaning: pass out by hand: flyers or whatever

jukugo.word: 心配 する ( しんぱい する)
description: 心 (heart) + 配 (distribute) = 心配 (worry)

jukugo.word: 配達 する ( はいたつ する)
jukugo.meaning: to deliver. Used about business - used when money changes hands. Deliver by truck or UPS or FEDEX.
description: 配 (distribute) + 達 (plural/delivery) = 配達 (deliver)

jukugo.word: 配慮 する ( はいりょ する)
jukugo.meaning: to give consideration to, to be kind to xxxx. To give special treatment to (the handicapped, i.e. by providing ramps)
description: 配 (distribute) + 慮 (consideration) = 配慮 (to give consideration to, to be kind to xxxx. To give special treatment to (the handicapped, i.e. by providing ramps))

mnemonic: I demand that you take that CUTE beret off before you go swimming in the water. You don't want the colors to run!!!

kunyomi.meaning: to demand　OR request

jukugo.word: 要求 する ( ようきゅう する)
jukugo.meaning: demand - more strident than the related word 求める　（もとめる）
description: 要 (important) + 求 (demand/ask) = 要求 (demand)
欲 (want) + 求 (demand/ask) = 欲求 (personal needs)

mnemonic: The director demands to be rescued. (FYI: he was a porno when your mom's body caused all the cameras to break, leaving him $90,000 in debt to the Mob)

kunyomi.meaning: to rescue　(really dramatic - only use this regarding bankruptcy or death).

jukugo.word: 救急車 ( きゅうきゅうしゃ )
description: 救 (rescue) + 急 (urgent) + 車 (car) = 救急車 (ambulance)

mnemonic: The king demands that you show your CUTE spheres at the imperial court tomorrow.

kunyomi.meaning: (narrow meaning) ball used in sports

jukugo.meaning: the world, the physical planet Earth.
description: 地 (area) + 球 (sphere) = 地球 (earth)
野 (field) + 球 (sphere) = 野球 (baseball)

jukugo.meaning: eyeball (doctor's word- most people just say 目玉　（めだま）)
description: 眼 (eyeball) + 球 (sphere) = 眼球 (eyeball)
Because it looks like a cliff, dummy.

mnemonic: The strict Director is tossing baby birds off of the cliff AGAIN.
description: I have no idea what the crazy shit on the lower left corner is!

kunyomi.meaning: a strict (teacher, sergeant, cop)

jukugo.word: 威厳 のある ( いげん のある)
jukugo.meaning: majestic , slow and dignified but scary - like a bunch of gangsters slowly walking down the street while the Peter Gunn theme plays. Or a parade float of your mom's neck-beard.
description: 威 (terrible majesty) + 厳 (strict) = 威厳 (majestic/scary)
厳 (strict) + 禁 (prohibition) = 厳禁 (strictly forbidden. )

mnemonic: RAY Smuckles smokes pot pretty diligently.
Ten thousand strong lemmings dilligently leapt off the cliff.

kunyomi.meaning: to cheer up or encourage someone
to concentrate and work diligently on something (1/2 KANA)

jukugo.word: 激励 する ( げきれい する)
description: 激 (intense) + 励 (diligence) = 激励 (encouragement, incitement )

mnemonic: RAY KEEPS a chronicle of the time he stopped under a cliff and found a grove of hella bud growing there.
description: This kind of means 'permanent record,' as in, 'Young man, this will go on your. . .'It's used a lot in words relating to school or business experience, but who cares. Basically you only need the following ２ words：
歴 (chronicle) + 史 (history) = 歴史 (history)

jukugo.word: 履歴書 ( りれきしょ )
description: 履 (put on pants or shoes) + 歴 (chronicle) + 書 (write) = 履歴書 (one's work resume.)

mnemonic: You could fit something hella thick inside your massive COLON.
The child has a thick head! He stared at the sun, fell off a cliff, but was unhurt because he landed on his thick head!

kunyomi.meaning: thick

jukugo.word: 厚化粧 ( あつげしょう )
description: 厚 (thick) + 化粧 (makeup) = 厚化粧 (really thick makeup.)

mnemonic: He's always pressuring me, telling me what I OUGHT TO do!
The earth under the cliff is under a lot of pressure.

jukugo.word: 圧倒 する ( あっとう する)
jukugo.meaning: to overwhelm (圧倒的な (あっとうてきな )= overpowering)
description: 圧 (pressure) + 倒 (knock down) = 圧倒 (overwhelm)
圧 (pressure) + 迫 (press upon) = 圧迫 (pressure)

jukugo.meaning: physical pressure (usually seen on tanks of high-pressure gas)
description: 圧 (pressure) + 力 (strong) = 圧力 (physical pressure)

mnemonic: SHOW me some makeup that doesn't make me look like a whore, please.
If you put rice under enough pressure, it turns into makeup. It's like coal and diamonds.

description: 化 (transform) + 粧 (makeup) = 化粧 (makeup)

jukugo.word: 厚化粧 ( あつげしょう )
description: 厚 (thick) + 化粧 (makeup) = 厚化粧 (really thick makeup.)

mnemonic: The flowers furnish pollen for the BEES.
The flowers by the cliff are furnished for the use of persons such as tourists to utilize.

kunyomi.meaning: set some shit aside for an emergency. (for instance, by saving money for a rainy day, or by stocking the basement with canned food for when the Apocalypse comes).

jukugo.word: 準備 する ( じゅんび する)
jukugo.meaning: this is the main word you'll use with this kanji: prepare (packing for a vacation, getting the restaurant ready to open for the day, and putting on makeup are all junbi).
description: 準 (prepare / criteria) + 備 (furnish) = 準備 (get ready)

jukugo.word: 警備 する ( けいび する)
jukugo.meaning: the type of guard who protects innocent people: the security guy at the bank, the Secret Service.
description: 警 (the fuzz) + 備 (furnish) = 警備 (guard)

mnemonic: The cliff burned up - all that remained was gray ash.

kunyomi.meaning: ashes

description: 灰 (ash/ gray) + 色 (color) = 灰色 (gray color)
灰 (ash/ gray) + 皿 (plate) = 灰皿 (ashtray)

mnemonic: SANTA Claus stands on top of the cliff and produces toys, giving them life, and then they roll downhill into your chimney.
description: a bit of a FR (women are child factories? According to Japanese politicians, yes.)

kunyomi.meaning: to give birth (human or animal) .This is more of a medical or agricultural word. Normally we use the OTHER うむ　（生む） for everyday childbirth. (NP)

description: 土 (earth) + 産 (childbirth, production of things) = お土産 (souvenir )

jukugo.meaning: heavy industry, like 'the steel or construction industry.'
description: 産 (childbirth, production of things) + 業 (business) = 産業 (heavy industry)
生 (life / birth) + 産 (childbirth, production of things) = 生産 (production)

mnemonic: I'll go back to my origins AGAIN: I originated on a tiny white cliff. (FYI, I'm a cormorant, coming home to the ol' guano colony to mate)

(not sure that that helps you remember the actual kanji, but I went to the trouble of making a whole back-story for the cormorant, and I figure I should get credit for it (he overcame many obstacles))
description: JERK - by itself it means 'high plain', but used with another kanji it means 'original'

kunyomi.meaning: a high plain. (not useful, unless you are a High Plains Drifter, and concoct a Black and Tan in your brandy Snifter)

description: 原 (original/ high plain) + 因 (origin) = 原因 (cause)

jukugo.meaning: the A-bomb　(a contraction of 原子爆弾 (げんしばくだん)) (NEO)
description: 原 (original/ high plain) + 爆 (explode) = 原爆 (A-bomb　)

jukugo.word: 原住民 ( げんじゅうみん )
jukugo.meaning: a person or animal native to the area. Indigenous.
description: 原 (original/ high plain) + 住民 (residents) = 原住民 (native)

mnemonic: Once AGAIN we have found a watery hot spring on the high plain. Everyone in!

kunyomi.meaning: a spring like where water comes out of the ground

jukugo.meaning: light socket, where you plug shit in.
description: 電 (electricity) + 源 (hot spring　/ origin) = 電源 (light socket)

mnemonic: HAN Solo threw your Mom's crotch off a cliff because he's anti-herpes.

jukugo.word: 反対 する ( はんたい する)
description: 反 (anti) + 対 (against) = 反対 (against it!!!!!!!!!!)
反 (anti) + 則 (rule) = 反則 (foul! To break a rule!)

jukugo.word: 反抗 する ( はんこう する)
jukugo.meaning: to be rebellious, defiant. To start a revolt. Unlike the related words 抵抗　（ていこう）　and 対抗　（たいこう）、　反抗 has the nuance of 'rebel for the fuck of it,' like a teenager would.
description: 反 (anti) + 抗 (oppose) = 反抗 (rebel)

jukugo.meaning: a reaction - despite the 反 kanji, 反応 is not neccesairly a bad reaction. As a noun, it's value-free. (careful! This is pronounced NOU, not OU) (FP)
description: 反 (anti) + 応 (react) = 反応 (a reaction )

mnemonic: I am moving towards you, to return the HEN to you, against her wishes (FYI you are a butcher)

kunyomi.meaning: I return something
something is returned or restored to its former state

jukugo.word: お 返事 する (お へんじ する)
jukugo.meaning: reply. In Japan, even if you respond to your friend's email 5 minutes after you got it, you have to start all mails with "Sorry my reply is so slow." (お返事が遅くてゴメン！）　（おへんじ　が　おそくて　ゴメン）
description: 返 (return) + 事 (action/ incident) = 返事 (reply)

jukugo.word: 繰り返し ( くりかえし )
description: 繰 (spin) + 返 (return) = 繰り返し (to repeat over and over.)

mnemonic: HAN solo, accustomed to the zero-gravity of space, is against climbing the steep slopes of the earth!

kunyomi.meaning: a slope of a hill (BOOBOO: not the hill itself. Hills are the similar-sounding おか！）

jukugo.word: 下り坂 ( くだりざか )
jukugo.meaning: A noun meaning, "the act of going downhill." Unhelpfully, this is not used as a verb. What the hell, man?
description: 下 (below) + 坂 (slope) = 下り坂 (go downhill )

jukugo.word: 上り坂 ( のぼりざか )
jukugo.meaning: "the act of going uphill." Same deal.
description: 上 (above) + 坂 (slope) = 上り坂 (go uphill )

mnemonic: The tree is against being cut down and made into a fucking board.
In fact it wants you to sign this petition BANning the practice altogether.
But the petition is made from the paper of an endangered redwood, you say!
Fuck!!!

kunyomi.meaning: a board, blackboard, etc.

description: 看 (observe/guard) + 板 (board) = 看板 (store sign)

mnemonic: CARRie is against people, so she can only be a provisional friend of ours.

kunyomi.meaning: suppose, as in "Suppose, for the sake of argument, that you were a doctor".

description: 仮 (provisional) + 面 (front surface / face) = 仮面 (mask)

jukugo.meaning: all the Japanese letterforms which are not Kanji - hiragana, katakana, okurigana, furigana, oshirigana, nurenuregana, bakana, and whatever they think up next!
description: 仮 (provisional) + 名 (name, famous) = 仮名 (kana)

mnemonic: The more money he spends on transactions, the less he has in his wallet. So,transactions are against money.

jukugo.word: 自動販売機 ( じどうはんばいき )
jukugo.meaning: vending machine, usually shortened to. . . 自販機(じはんき)
description: 自 (my own) + 動 (movement) + 販 (transaction) + 売 (sell) + 機 (machine) = 自動販売機 (vending machine)

jukugo.word: 限定販売 ( げんていはんばい )
description: 限 (limit) + 定 (plan) + 販売 (sales) = 限定販売 (limited edition)
販 (transaction) + 売 (sell) = 販売 (sales)

mnemonic: If you SAY you'll get good at kanji, eventually you will become good.
The scissors fell off the cliff and became dangerous spears, piercing the brains of innocent people below. (see also: pennies dropped off Empire State Building become bullets)

kunyomi.meaning: to become (1/2 KANA)

jukugo.meaning: completion (noun) - usually said of a painting, construction of a building, or other physically creative project.
description: 完 (complete) + 成 (become) = 完成 (completion)

jukugo.word: 成功 する ( せいこう する)
description: 成 (become) + 功 (success) = 成功 (success)

jukugo.meaning: "ohhhh, now I see!" (very similar to a hearty 分かった！！　（わかった）, but it also has the nuance of, understanding AND agreeing whole-heartedly) (KANA, KUNKUN)
description: 成 (become) + 程 (extent) = 成程 (oh, I see!)

mnemonic: If you always SAY the truth, you will become a sincere person.

kunyomi.meaning: faithfulness, fidelity　to your boss or superior person.

jukugo.word: 誠実 な ( せいじつ な)
jukugo.meaning: fidelity to your lover. (used as noun or na-adjective)
description: 誠 (sincerity) + 実 (truth) = 誠実 (fidelity)

mnemonic: The Nazis ran BEYOND the limits of good taste and became extinct.
description: Unlike the OTHER こす　（超す） , which means go OVER (a number or limit), THIS 越す means go BEYOND - physically.

kunyomi.meaning: I go beyond (a physical thing) - I pass or crosss something (a lake, a city, etc)
something crosses something else

jukugo.word: 引っ越す ( ひっこす )
jukugo.meaning: move to a new house or apartment
description: 引 (pull) + 越 (go beyond) = 引っ越す (move to a new house or apartment)

jukugo.word: 追い越す ( おいこす )
description: 追 (follow) + 越 (go beyond) = 追い越す (overtake)

mnemonic: We keep an elephant (象) in the traditional storehouse.
The vassal piled up flowers until they became a traditional storehouse.

kunyomi.meaning: an obsolete word for a building where you store food on farm - a silo or barn. (OBSOLETE)

jukugo.word: 冷蔵庫 ( れいぞうこ )
description: 冷 (cold thing) + 蔵 (traditional storehouse) + 庫 (warehouse) = 冷蔵庫 (the fuckin' fridge )

jukugo.word: 内蔵 の ( ないぞう の)
jukugo.meaning: built-in (don't confuse this with 内臓 which means internal organ)
description: 内 (the inside) + 蔵 (traditional storehouse) = 内蔵 (built-in)

mnemonic: The internal organs of ZOUs (象 = elephants) are hella big, dogg.
The internal organs are nothing but little warm moist storehouses full of nutrients, blood, lymph, hormones, etc.

description: 心 (heart) + 臓 (internal organ) = 心臓 (heart)
内 (the inside) + 臓 (internal organ) = 内臓 (internal organ)
肺 (lung) + 臓 (internal organ) = 肺臓 (lung)
肝 (liver) + 臓 (internal organ) = 肝臓 (liver)

mnemonic: He SIGHed as he turned another year old. Closer to the grave, my friend, closer to the grave!
When you turn 10 years old you stop being small, and you become a tween!

jukugo.meaning: counter for "years old" that a person is. (COUNTER)
Fuckin' banzai, man!!!! (literally '10,000 years', meaning, 'May the Emperor live 10,000 years!' is what you shout as you charge into battle) (1/2 KANA)
description: 万 (10000) + 歳 (years old) = 万歳 (banzai!)

jukugo.meaning: twenty years old - traditionally the age at which Japanese turn into adults and get presents, kimono, etc. So, naturally it has its own special pronunciation that doesn't make any sense, since it SHOULD be called にじゅうさい。 Whatever. Tradition. (FP, CCW)
description: 二 (two) + 十 (ten) + 歳 (years old) = 二十歳 (twenty years old)

mnemonic: This word has an unusual onyomi but it's easy to remember if you know who Tom METZGER is. Let's annihilate Metzger!
A flood of water and a hail of fire, together they become a wave of annihilation!

kunyomi.meaning: to get fucked up.
to annhilate - usually used about an enemy in wartime, or destroy the earth, or wipe Al Queda out. Not used about a single person usually.

jukugo.meaning: the downfall of a civilization or the dying-out of a certain ethnic group. But it doesn't have 'downfall's moral judgement.
description: 滅 (annihilate) + 亡 (dying) = 滅亡 (downfall)

jukugo.word: 撲滅 する ( ぼくめつ する)
jukugo.meaning: eradicate (a pest or disease) 'The new task force will eradicate drugs once and for all!'
description: 撲 (eradicate) + 滅 (annihilate) = 撲滅 (eradicate)

jukugo.word: 絶滅 する ( ぜつめつ する)
description: 絶 (extinct) + 滅 (annihilate) = 絶滅 (go extinct)

mnemonic: The dude became a woman, and as she vogued majestically, and I was scared!
description: This is one of the most "no-English-equivalent-y" words in the whole Japanese language. Why is majestic stuff scary? Who is scared of Prince? He's like five feet tall. I guess you have to think like a medieval peasant to really get the meaning.

jukugo.word: 威厳 のある ( いげん のある)
jukugo.meaning: majestic , slow and dignified but scary - like a bunch of gangsters slowly walking down the street while the Peter Gunn theme plays. Or a parade float of your mom's neck-beard.
description: 威 (terrible majesty) + 厳 (strict) = 威厳 (majestic/scary)

jukugo.meaning: an authority one has based on power alone (parents, cops, etc.) rather than on rights (authority based on rights is　権利（けんり））
description: 権 (rights) + 威 (terrible majesty) = 権威 (authority)

jukugo.word: 威張ってる ( いばってる )
description: 威 (terrible majesty) + 張 (stretch) = 威張ってる (arrogant)

mnemonic: JOE Stalin needs a castle to defend himself from the Trotskyites.
This earth will become a castle after you finish building it, so get cracking, Serf-boy!

kunyomi.meaning: castle

mnemonic: Eazy did too much crack aGAIN and saw an hallucination of some scissors coming to get him.

kunyomi.meaning: a phantom, an illusion　－ like 幻覚 but more broad - it can be sounds, tastes, etc.

description: 幻 (illusion) + 覚 (bear in mind) = 幻覚 (hallucination)

mnemonic: GET in a good mood and KEEP being in a good mood.
I'm in a loco mood - I may stab you with scissors or shoot you with a rifle in this mood.

kunyomi.meaning: basically, 'mood', but there are over 3,000 expressions that use it. KI can be put in, become exhausted ,become lost, change, be pulled, be big, small, changing. KI gets followed, met, used, lightened, lengthened, shortened, rotated, cut. KI can be strong, weak, floating, heavy. . .. but you never say, "how's your ki doing ?" or "I've got great ki today!" - You have to use it as part of an expression. (CCW)

jukugo.meaning: oh HELLS yeah. It feels good.(although this isn't dirty by itself, it is the #1 actual word yelled in pornos.)
description: 気 (mood) + 持 (hold) = 気持ち (feels good!)

jukugo.meaning: cheerful, energetic. Doesn't matter if it's totally forced. (CCW)
description: 元 (original) + 気 (mood) = 元気 (cheerful)
天 (heaven) + 気 (mood) = 天気 (weather)

jukugo.word: 気を付けて ( きをつけて )
description: 気 (mood) + 付 (stick to) = 気を付けて (be careful!)

jukugo.word: 気にしない ( きにしない )
気になった ( きになった )
気付いた ( きづいた )
jukugo.meaning: to belatedly realize something - d'oh! (also pronounced 気がついた）
description: 気 (mood) + 付 (stick to) = 気付いた (realize something)

jukugo.meaning: (literally, 'different feeling') crazy - this is one of the biggest cusses in the whole language-a garunteed fight-starter. This is instructive in several ways.
description: 1) Japanese is such a polite language that 'different feeling' is one of the worst insults.
2) it takes a certain kind of culture to think that having a different feeling is such a bad thing in the first place!
3) Historically it is a discriminatory term against people who suffer from mental illness. (ABU)
気 (mood) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 気違い (fuckin' crazy)

jukugo.word: 気晴らし に ( きばらし に)
jukugo.meaning: Just for fun, do you wanna (blah blah blah)?"
description: 気 (mood) + 晴 (weather get good now) = 気晴らし (Just for fun)

mnemonic: He decided to take a big pair of scissors and cut open a bag of KETCHUP, and it rained out of the bag like water.

kunyomi.meaning: I decided
it has been decided

description: 解 (solve / untie) + 決 (decide) = 解決 (solution)

jukugo.word: 決定 する ( けってい する)
jukugo.meaning: to make a real serious decision； like, "I know I'm always saying I'm going to lose 1２ pounds but this time I really mean it."
description: 決 (decide) + 定 (plan) = 決定 (make a serious decision)

jukugo.word: 決して XXXXない! ( けっして XXXXない!)
jukugo.meaning: I'll HELL OF never do XXX.

mnemonic: Flying KITES is pleasant!, which is why the Taliban banned it.
It's pleasant to stick a big pair of open scissors in someone's heart. . . (FYI you are a Inca high priest. Duh!)

kunyomi.meaning: pleasant, warm atmosphere

jukugo.meaning: a physical sensation of pleasure - usually but not always sexual.
description: 快 (pleasant) + 感 (feeling) = 快感 (pleasure)

jukugo.word: 愉快 な ( ゆかい な)
jukugo.meaning: pleasant or amusing (a funny guy, hilarious comments, a fun time)
description: 愉 (pleasure) + 快 (pleasant) = 愉快 (amusing)

mnemonic: 口 (mouth/small box radical) + 一 (one/line radical)
description: A mouth with a tiny, narrow Moustache above it. What could be Hitlier?That's right. I said "Hitlier."

mnemonic: GodDAMN it! My water became Hitler again! Decrease the amount of Hitlers in my water, si vous plait! Get me a fuckin' Brita or semething!

kunyomi.meaning: I decrease it
it decreases

jukugo.word: いい加減にしろ！ ( いいかげんにしろ! )
description: 加 (add) + 減 (decrease) = いい加減にしろ！ (cut it out!)

jukugo.word: いい加減 な ( いいかげん な)
jukugo.meaning: unfounded or groundless. Not a lie exactly, but someone who is just bullshitting, talking without saying anything meaningful or definite. Also means, working in a haphazard, hit-or-miss fashion. (CCW)
description: 加 (add) + 減 (decrease) = いい加減 (unfounded, pointless)

mnemonic: Genghis KAHN , deep in his heart, feels that he has become as bad as Hitler. Why did he ransack and pillage so much?

kunyomi.meaning: to feel something

description: 感 (feeling) + 情 (emotion) = 感情 (a feeling, an emotion)

jukugo.word: に 感謝 する (に かんしゃ する)
jukugo.meaning: The most common, general word for gratitude.
description: 感 (feeling) + 謝 (apologize) = 感謝 (gratitude)

jukugo.word: 感動 する ( かんどう する)
jukugo.meaning: to be moved by something (a song, a movie, a speech, a pretty poem about asndfisdnf)
description: 感 (feeling) + 動 (movement) = 感動 (emotionally moved)

mnemonic: It's regrettable that the human heart is so emotional, said Mr. Spock.

jukugo.meaning: a fairly formal way to say, "Aaaah shiit!!" Really really regrettable, deplorable. Only use this about some big thing - North Koreans kidnapping people, or that time you accidentally wiped your nose with the Emperor's tie. (F)
description: 遺 (bequeath) + 憾 (regrettable) = 遺憾! (aaah shit!)

mnemonic: When I saw George Michael and Hitler's moustaches at the same time, I went DOH!!

kunyomi.meaning: same

jukugo.word: もう一度 ( もういちど )
description: 一 (one) + 度 (times) = もう一度 (one more time!)

jukugo.word: 同時 に ( どうじ に)
description: 同 (same) + 時 (time) = 同時 (at the same time)

jukugo.word: 同様 に ( どうよう に)
jukugo.meaning: in the same way. For example, "In the same way caffeine perks up the mind, your dad's naked pictures perk up the body."
description: 同 (same) + 様 (important person) = 同様 (in the same way)

mnemonic: He keeps using that same bamboo cylinder to suck his TOES.

kunyomi.meaning: usually defined as pipe but more accurately, it means cylinder.
JUKUGO:
封 (seal in) + 筒 (cylinder /pipe) = 封筒 (envelope)

mnemonic: SHE administers Hitler's Moustache with her little scissors.

jukugo.meaning: anyone at work who out-ranks you
description: 上 (above) + 司 (administer) = 上司 (upper person)

jukugo.word: 司会者 ( しかいしゃ )
jukugo.meaning: a master of ceremonies of a TV show or event. It's not used for 'sucker MCs' which is a darn shame.
description: 司 (administer) + 会 (big meeting) + 者 (professional) = 司会者 (master of ceremonies)

mnemonic: SHE is a person who makes formal visits (i.e. a diplomat)

kunyomi.meaning: formal visit　(only used by the lower person who is visiting the upper person) Also formal way of saying "ask" (ditto: lower to upper) (F)

mnemonic: SHE uses parts of speech very well, for a girl.
When we say things, parts of speech administer the syntax.

description: 名 (name, famous) + 詞 (part of speech) = 名詞 (noun)

jukugo.word: 形容詞 ( けいようし )
description: 形 (form) + 容 (appearance) + 詞 (part of speech) = 形容詞 (adjective)
動 (movement) + 詞 (part of speech) = 動詞 (verb)
歌 (sing) + 詞 (part of speech) = 歌詞 (lyrics)

mnemonic: Man (personleft) + ??? (???)
description: imagine a person on the left, holding out their arm and thumb (on the right), hitchhiking.

mnemonic: We're all sleeping in the same van this trip, so you gotta Regulate Your Odor.
When we go on a trip in that direction, we bring a rifle to shoot hitchhikers.

kunyomi.meaning: a trip

jukugo.word: へ　or 　に 旅行 する (へ　or 　に りょこう する)
jukugo.meaning: a vacation, or just travel in general.
description: 旅 (trip) + 行 (go) = 旅行 (vacation)

jukugo.meaning: a traditional Japanese inn that costs like 300 bones a night.
description: 旅 (trip) + 館 (big hall) = 旅館 (inn)

mnemonic: HAHA, I laugh at your faction! Bloody splitters!
That faction wants to hitchhike to the water, but our faction wants to hitch a ride to the cliff.

jukugo.word: 立派 な ( りっぱ な)
description: 立 (stand up) + 派 (faction/bling) = 立派 (super high class!)

jukugo.word: 派手 な ( はで な)
description: 派 (faction/bling) + 手 (hand) = 派手 (gaudy)

jukugo.meaning: A faction within a political party or corporation. Like every country has factions, but 派閥 has the nuance of 'We all claim to be loyal to the organization but behind closed doors we are plotting to hijack it with our own agenda.' Nobody would say publicly, "I'm in this 派閥！” (NP)
description: 派 (faction/bling) + 閥 (clique) = 派閥 (faction)

mnemonic: Yo Mama's so old, she has more purple veins in her breasts than MY YAK has in its whole body.
Veins are an organ that allow your blood cells to hitch-hike all over your body.
description: WHY BOTHER ? You need this to say, "juice, connections, pull, clout."
人 (person) + 脈 (vein) = 人脈 (clout)
脈 (vein) + 拍 (clap) = 脈拍 (pulse)
The hitch hiker was talking with her mouth about how she wanted to travel really far.

mnemonic: Please ENjoy the trip as you move to a far away place on earth.

kunyomi.meaning: far away

jukugo.word: 遠慮 する ( えんりょ する)
jukugo.meaning: CULTURAL CODE WORD in full effect. Meaning, it's such a uniquely Japanese concept there is no ready English equivalent.
description: 遠慮 means to be diplomatically, politely refuse, to regretfully decline.
For example, "You want the last donut?" "Hell yes!" is not 遠慮.
But, "No way I don't want it, it smells!" is also not 遠慮 .
"Thanks but I'm full now." is the 遠慮 answer, since it means, "We both know I want it, but since I abstained from it, you owe me one, now! The favor-ball is back in my court!"
Used most commonly in two situations：
1) 遠慮せず： meaning, 'Act casual. Eat the last pie. Don't wait for all the food to be served. Sit wherever. Make yourself at home.'
2) it's often seen on signs telling you not to do something: XXX遠慮してください。 ('Please refrain from doing XXX') (CCW, F)
遠 (far) + 慮 (consideration) = 遠慮 (regretfully decline or enjoin from)

jukugo.word: 永遠 に ( えいえん に)
jukugo.meaning: the poetic 'forever'： I'll hate you forever! We shall rule the world forever!
description: 永 (forever) + 遠 (far) = 永遠 (poetic forever)

mnemonic: Far away, there's a big box of ground, with trees and flowers, called a park.

description: 公 (public) + 園 (public park) = 公園 (park)

jukugo.word: 動物園 ( どうぶつえん )
description: 動物 (animal) + 園 (public park) = 動物園 (zoo)

jukugo.word: 遊園地 ( ゆうえんち )
description: 遊 (play around) + 園 (public park) + 地 (area) = 遊園地 (amusement park)

mnemonic: Genghis KHAN, The king, owns the environment around here. His dominion is like a net extending even to far places.

jukugo.meaning: environment (like English, this is not limited to nature. A bad kid can be a "product of his environment.")
description: 環 (environment) + 境 (border) = 環境 (environment)

mnemonic: I kick in the nuts, anyone with a cloth beret. I don't care who. Suge Knight ? Anyone. I'm fucking crazy I tell you.

kunyomi.meaning: garment in the abstract sense - the garment district, a clothes closet, etc.

jukugo.word: 更衣室 ( こういしつ )
description: 更 (all over again) + 衣 (cloth) + 室 (room) = 更衣室 (clothes-changing - room)

jukugo.meaning: yukata ； a summer kimono (1/2 KANA, FP)
description: 浴 (bathe) + 衣 (cloth) = 浴衣 (yukata ； a summer kimono)

mnemonic: HE'S YOUR master, and you express that by kissing the cloth hem of his robe. MUAH!

kunyomi.meaning: FRONT surface- used only about things that have a front-and-back. (opposite: 裏　うら） . Usually used about 2-dimensional things (paper, walls) but can also be used with the ol' tatemae/honne.

to indicate something intentionally, but through symbols rather than words( he expressed his displeasure by flinging feces at the prison correction officer) (the shadow of the sundial indicates the time) (KANA)

description: 表 (express) + 現 (present time) = 表現 (figure of speech)

jukugo.word: 発表 する ( はっぴょう する)
description: 発 (launch) + 表 (express) = 発表 (announcement)

jukugo.meaning: the exterior, the surface - unlike 面 (men), 表面 is more technical - usually used by architects or craftspeople. Or, for instance, to describe a "skin" you'd put on a polygon 3d character.
description: 表 (express) + 面 (front surface / face) = 表面 (exterior)

mnemonic: What clothes I wear depends on what kind of person I am.

jukugo.word: に 依存 する (に いぞん する)
jukugo.meaning: to depend on- usually in a bad way, like "America's dependency on foreign oil" (NP)
description: 依 (depend on) + 存 (be aware of) = 依存 (depend)

jukugo.word: 依頼 する ( いらい する)
jukugo.meaning: a request or commission. Not like 'Please pass the salt,' but like 'I'd like to hire you to make a custom suit' or to hire a lawyer or PR firm. Any relationship where you'd use the phrase "The client wants. . ... "is 依頼。

jukugo.meaning: the coast OR the beach! Unlike 浜辺 or 浜, 海岸 has a scientific meaning: the coastline, (regardless of if there's sand or not). You'll see 海岸 on maps or geography books. The useage of 海岸 is odd, even for Japanese. Where Americans will just say, "Let's go to the beach!", Japanese might suggest to their pals, "海へ行こう！”（let's go to the ocean!) but ONLY ONCE THEY WERE ALREADY THERE, then they might specifically suggest going to the 海岸 - as opposed to other things to do by the sea. Weird!
description: 海 (ocean) + 岸 (shore) = 海岸 (coast / beach)

jukugo.meaning: love or relationships in general - that is to say, if there's an ad for fortune-telling that says, "Test your luck in money! Love! and health!" it'll be using 恋愛. If there's an article in a womens' magazine, "How to get love in 10 steps!" it'll be using 恋愛. But you wouldn't tell a hot guy " I 恋愛 you very much!" See?
description: 恋 (passion) + 愛 (love) = 恋愛 (love in general)

mnemonic: The egg changes into a HEN after hatching.
Each red Communist changes into a yuppie when they turn 30.

kunyomi.meaning: I change something
something changes
abnormal or bad (FR)
JUKUGO:
変 (change) + 化 (transform) = 変化 (transformation, change)

kunyomi.word: 大変 な ( たいへん な)
kunyomi.meaning: this has 2 meanings, both used equally often:

kunyomi.word: a) I feel sorry for Tony because his job sucks and his girl is cheating.
kunyomi.meaning: b) Tony is a really scary, mean person.
変態 ( へんたい )

kunyomi.word: 変 (change) + 態 (looks like) = 変態 (perv)

kunyomi.meaning: 恋         passion         HEART         心
but EACH lover wants to change for another!

mnemonic: I have no idea what that top radical is supposed to be. So, regardless, here's a mnemonic:
I've waited a long time to kick my boss in the nuts.

kunyomi.meaning: long

description: 社 (company) + 長 (long / boss) = 社長 (company boss.)

jukugo.meaning: strong point, as opposed to weak point. Can be used about people (his 長所 is his courage, her 長所 is her brain) or machines ('The strong point of this PC is its long battery-life')
description: 長 (long / boss) + 所 (area / attribute) = 長所 (good point)

jukugo.meaning: height (BOOBOO; only about human bodies- not about buildings or, well, anything else)
description: 身 ((one's own) flesh) + 長 (long / boss) = 身長 (height)

jukugo.word: 延長 する ( えんちょう する)
jukugo.meaning: extension or prolonging, in time. Also means,to extend a linear thing by building it longer. A bit more official than the related term 伸ばす　(のばす).
description: 延 (prolong) + 長 (long / boss) = 延長 (prolonging)

mnemonic: as in, "It's a stretch to call Margaret CHO funny. "
Stretch the bow until it is really long.

kunyomi.meaning: to physically make something longer. stretch a rubber-band、 stretch a canvas on a paint frame, pitch a tent. Also to extend one's influence.

jukugo.meaning: No exact English equivalent. がんばる combines two English expressions: 1) do your best! 2) good luck! You tell your friends 頑張れ！ before a big test or job interview. (1/2 KANA, CCW)
description: 頑 (stubborn) + 張 (stretch) = 頑張る (good luck!)

jukugo.word: 緊張 する ( きんちょう する)
jukugo.meaning: stress, stretched to the max ーcan be used both literally and figuratively.
description: 緊 (tense) + 張 (stretch) = 緊張 (stress)

mnemonic: I keep a long dagger tucked in the spine of my notebook, so if anyone tries to copy my notes I can stab them.

jukugo.meaning: notebook. Not the big school kind. The tiny kind Japanese girls are always sitting alone in cafes penciling in their social engagements in. (KUN ON)
description: 手 (hand) + 帳 (notebook) = 手帳 (notebook)

mnemonic: Peaked%20roof (peaked roof) + 央 (central) + 一 (one/line radical)
description: It's risky to stand right in the center of a peaked roof during an earthquake.ridiculously strong RADICAL for KEN, so you can say:

mnemonic: FBI agents hide behind a tree to do a risky investigation.

jukugo.word: 検査 する ( けんさ する)
jukugo.meaning: Medical checkup. Also, investigation, inspection, review: (fiancial audit, smog check, check the condition of goods that roll off the assemby line, etc). Has the nuance of a test where something passes or fails.
description: 検 (investigate) + 査 (inspect) = 検査 (checkup)
検 (investigate) + 索 (look up) = 検索 (internet search)

jukugo.word: 検討 する ( けんとう する)
jukugo.meaning: to give thorough consideration to the topic. To investigate something thoroughly. Often said by politicians who don't want to give a real answer. (NP)
description: 検 (investigate) + 討 (attack/discuss) = 検討 (give consideration to)

mnemonic: KENNY is thrifty because his family's poor. He's also a risky person because he dies in every episode.

jukugo.word: 倹約 する ( けんやく する)
jukugo.meaning: frugal, saving money, getting bargains. (BOOBOO - 倹約 is used in a good way. If you want to say someone is cheap, say 'kechi!')
description: 倹 (thrifty) + 約 (promise/ roughly speaking) = 倹約 (frugal)

mnemonic: The saber is the riskiest type of sword. Because it's like a combination of 'stabber' and 'sandwitch.': you could be trying to eat and kill at the same time and get hella distracted. Oh shiiit!!!

jukugo.word: 真剣 な ( しんけん な)
description: 真 (truth) + 剣 (saber) = 真剣 (serious or earnest)
剣 (saber) + 道 (street) = 剣道 (wooden-sword fighting)

mnemonic: I'll test my gambling expertise by risking it all on that hose. I mean horse.

description: 経 (experience) + 験 (test) = 経験 (experience)
実 (truth) + 験 (test) = 実験 (a scientific experiment)

jukugo.meaning: a test, like in school - kind of formal. (BOOBOO : normally people just say テスト) (NP)
description: 試 (attempt to do) + 験 (test) = 試験 (test)

mnemonic: It's risky to build a town on such a steep hill.

kunyomi.meaning: a steep hill, or a very grim situation (but mostly a steep hill).

description: 冒 (risk) + 険 (steep) = 冒険 (adventure)
保 (guarantee/maintain ) + 険 (steep) = 保険 (insurance)

jukugo.word: 危険 な ( きけん な)
description: 危 (dangerous) + 険 (steep) = 危険 (risky, unsafe)

mnemonic: He won the lottery, moved out the trailer park, but he still won't share any gold with his KINfolk.
The horny king hoards his gold in a treasury with a peaked roof.
description: SYMBOLIC for metal and money.

kunyomi.meaning: スクリーラ!!! キャッシュ ルールス エブリシング アラウンド ミー!

description: 金 (gold) + 曜 (day of the week) = 金曜 (Friday (payday!))

jukugo.meaning: rich person AKA your mom's bail bondsman.
description: 金 (gold) + 持 (hold) = 金持ち (rich person)
料 (ingredients / fees) + 金 (gold) = 料金 (a fee, also, bills.)

jukugo.meaning: your mama's big hairy balls (KUN ON)
description: 金 (gold) + 玉 (ball) = 金玉 (balls)

jukugo.meaning: a debt - What the Yakuza comes to break your knees if you don't pay.
description: 借 (borrow) + 金 (gold) = 借金 (a debt)
金 (gold) + 庫 (warehouse) = 金庫 (a safe)

mnemonic: Fonzie says "EYYYY!!" as he sticks his sharp thumb up, to indicate his satisfaction.
Older brother has a sharp mind so he winds up earning a lot of gold.

kunyomi.meaning: sharp (1/2 KANA)

jukugo.word: 鋭敏 な ( えいびん な)
description: 鋭 (sharp) + 敏 (agile / sensitive) = 鋭敏 (quick-witted, keen.)

mnemonic: The master's gold rusted, reducing its yen value.

kunyomi.meaning: to rust (KANA)

jukugo.word: 錆付いた ( さびついた )
description: 錆 (rust) + 付 (stick to) = 錆付いた (rusted / rusty)

mnemonic: Recording a ROCK song about a wet snout will earn us a lot of gold!
It's what all the kids are into these days.

jukugo.word: 録音 する ( ろくおん する)
description: 録 (record) + 音 (sound) = 録音 (sound recording)

jukugo.word: 登録 する ( とうろく する)
jukugo.meaning: to enter data, or to register for something - (usually means filling out a form)
description: 登 (climb) + 録 (record) = 登録 (register, enter data)

mnemonic: Stand up to look in the metal mirror.

kunyomi.meaning: mirror

jukugo.word: 顕微鏡 ( けんびきょう )
description: 微 (teeny) + 鏡 (mirror) = 顕微鏡 (microscope)

jukugo.word: 望遠鏡 ( ぼうえんきょう )
description: 望 (desire) + 遠 (far) + 鏡 (mirror) = 望遠鏡 (telescope)

mnemonic: I SAW / saw a golden chain, locked around the baby birds, which were sitting on money. I guess that's one way of keeping it safe.

kunyomi.meaning: chain

jukugo.meaning: chain. Usually used figuratively: chain store and chain reaction. Cycle of child-abuse. Food chain.
description: 連 (take with / inform of) + 鎖 (shut/chain) = 連鎖 (chain)

mnemonic: I'll give you silver in exchange for GIN.
Sliver is as good as gold, what is not good is being broke.

description: 銀 (silver) + 行 (go) = 銀行 (bank)

jukugo.meaning: Ginza , a ritzy neighborhood in tokyo
description: 銀 (silver) + 座 (sit) = 銀座 (Ginza)

jukugo.word: 銀行口座 ( ぎんこうこうざ )
description: 銀行 (bank) + 口 (mouth) + 座 (sit) = 銀行口座 (bank account)

mnemonic: Give me ten gold needles please.

kunyomi.meaning: a needle

description: 針 (needle) + 金 (gold) = 針金 (a wire)

mnemonic: The Olympic athlete went DOH when they gave her the bronze medal, because it's just not the same as gold.

jukugo.word: 銅メダル ( どうめだる )
description: 銅 (bronze) + メ () = 銅メダル (bronze medal.)

mnemonic: It is traditional to serve flower-scented tea to the HOE under the peaked roof. (it's this hostess club for recovering alcoholics, is what it is)

description: 茶 (tea) + 色 (color) = 茶色 (brown)

jukugo.word: 喫茶店 ( きっさてん )
jukugo.meaning: a coffee-shop. These are really popular because Japanese don't invite people over to their homes very often - they meet at the coffee-shop. This is fairly polite example to point to when a Japanese asks you, "Do foreigners really think we're a cold people?" BOOBOO: most Japanese don't say きっさてん。 they just say 喫茶、(きっさ)。
description: 喫 (enjoy a drink and a smoke) + 茶 (tea) + 店 (shop) = 喫茶店 (coffe-shop)

jukugo.meaning: green tea (AKA the only time you'll ever use the on-yomi for 'green')
description: 緑 (green) + 茶 (tea) = 緑茶 (green tea)
紅 (dark lipstick red color) + 茶 (tea) = 紅茶 (black tea )

mnemonic: SANTA Claus uses an umbrella at the north pole, to deal with the fallin' snow.
Ten people - - uh,. . .you know what? Actually this kanji LOOKS like an umbrella so fuck it.

kunyomi.meaning: umbrella (KANA)

jukugo.word: yyy 傘下 のxxx (yyy さんか のxxx)
jukugo.meaning: YYY, which is a subsidiary of XXX. (Fanta is a subsidiary of Coke)
description: 傘 (umbrella) + 下 (below) = 傘下 (subsidiary)

mnemonic: All kings do ZEN meditation under a peaked temple roof.

kunyomi.meaning: absolutely / completeley (I absolutely don't know this man, officer! He's completely crazy)

description: 全 (all) + 部 (section) = 全部 (all of it)

jukugo.meaning: absolutely! (usually used to emphasize the word after it. But sometimes, the word being emphasized is omitted because it's so obvious (to Japanese))
description: If you hear someone say 'Zenzen!' with no word after it, it might mean 'zenzen daijoubu,' ('Absolutely no problemo.') . . .
OR it might mean 'zen zen dame!' ('No effing way, guy!') (1/2 KANA)
全 (all) + 然 (nature) = 全然 (absolutely! )

jukugo.meaning: all the members of the group
description: 全 (all) + 員 (clerk) = 全員 (all members)
全 (all) + 国 (country) = 全国 (nationwide)

mnemonic: I have a scheme to stop at the house with the peaked roof tonight. (FYI it's full of rad scientists)
I have the KEY, don't worry, we can get in.
Then we can teach them kanji via Yo Mama jokes and in return they'll give us some shrink-rays. Raddd!!

kunyomi.meaning: to scheme, to be up to something. to be hatching a nefarious plan.

jukugo.meaning: plan - not like, 'I'm planning on going to Lake Tahoe this weekend," but like a big-time business plan or world-domination scheme. (NP, FP)
description: 企 (scheme) + 画 (a drawing) = 企画 (plan)

mnemonic: I was SHOCKED when the dude ate like Jello with eels in it.
It's good to eat in a restaurant with a peaked roof. Shows class.
description: SYMBOLIC 2/3 of the time.

kunyomi.meaning: eat

to devour!!! it's kind of a more mean way of saying 'to eat.'- most of the negative, dark expressions involving eating use KUU rather than TABERU. Also - very seldom - it means to make a living, as in the English phrase, 'You gotta work to eat.'

jukugo.meaning: food. Can be used of the ingredients OR the finished, cooked product.
description: 食 (eat) + 物 (animal / thing) = 食べ物 (food)
和 (peace/ Japan) + 食 (eat) = 和食 (Japanese-style food)
洋 (Pacific Ocean / the West) + 食 (eat) = 洋食 (western food)
軽 (lightweight) + 食 (eat) = 軽食 (light meal, snack)

jukugo.word: 人食い xxx ( ひとくい xxx)
description: 人 (person) + 食 (eat) = 人食い (a man-eating XXX.)

mnemonic: Drink it all IN. That's right, chug.
Drinking is like eating but with a lack of solids.

kunyomi.meaning: drink, or take medicine

description: 飲 (drink) + 物 (animal / thing) = 飲み物 (beverages )

jukugo.meaning: a person who likes to drink booze
description: 酒 (liquor) + 飲 (drink) = 酒飲み (heavy drinker)

mnemonic: He decorates the food he eats with rifles and daggers. it is quite SHOCking if you eat one on accident.

kunyomi.meaning: to decorate your room/ lunchbox / fingernails
a display (good, bad, or excessive!)

mnemonic: HAN Solo is against eating rice, because he thinks that it looks like little white maggots.
description: COCK: as if the 飯/米 synonyms were not confusing enough, 飯 has ANOTHER meaning, PRONOUNCED DIFFERENTLY.

kunyomi.meaning: literally, cooked rice. But usually used to mean, 'a meal.'

jukugo.meaning: two meanings - 1) cooked rice, 2) a meal (KANA)
description: 御 (the honorific "o") + 飯 (rice / meal) = 御飯 (rice)

jukugo.word: 炊飯器 ( すいはんき )
description: 炊 (cook rice) + 飯 (rice / meal) + 器 (instrument) = 炊飯器 (rice-cooker)

mnemonic: SHE administrates when and what her pet eats.

kunyomi.meaning: to keep a pet

description: 飼 (keep a pet) + 主 (master/mainly) = 飼い主 (pet owner)

mnemonic: Genghis KHAN pulls the elephant by the trunk.
This morning, I dried my roof by draping it over the trunk of a tree.

kunyomi.meaning: a tree trunk

jukugo.word: 新幹線 ( しんかんせん )
description: 新 (new) + 幹 (trunk) + 線 (line) = 新幹線 (bullet train)

jukugo.meaning: as a prefix, it means the main (office, manager, road) rather than a branch one (PRE)

mnemonic: I SHALL lean out of the veranda of my opulent mansion and make fun of your humble hut.
A hut is nothing more than a peaked roof propped up over an earth floor, (with no walls) and a mouth inside, eating and snoring.
description: This kanji is kind of obsolete - hence zero stars! - but you need it to say "countryside" and it's also useful as a radical.
田 (rice field) + 舎 (hut) = 田舎 (countryside)

mnemonic: Use your hand to throw away that old hut. It's falling down anyway. Build something new, out of concrete!

kunyomi.meaning: throw out

jukugo.word: 使い捨て のXXX ( つかいすて のXXX)
description: 使 (use) + 捨 (throw away) = 使い捨て (disposable)

mnemonic: We got excess YOYOS so we are selling at a discount.
Show me your excess roofs!
Yeah, that IS a lot of roofs. I don't think we are prepared to dispose of that many roofs. What the hell kind of manic shopping spree did you go on, anyway???
description: Despite being pronounced YO, this kanji has a STRONG ONYOMI for "JO".

kunyomi.word: ( に or が ) あま＊る
kunyomi.meaning: the excess, suruplus (excess labor drives down wages) (surplus food rots on docks)

jukugo.meaning: room/time/money to spare. Like, don't sweat it.
description: 余 (excess) + 裕 (abundant) = 余裕 (time/room to spare)

jukugo.word: 余計 な ( よけい な)
jukugo.meaning: excessive, uncalled-for, and unnecessary (usually used in the context of 余計なお世話だよ！　（よけいなおせわだよ！）: 'Mind your own business!')
description: 余 (excess) + 計 (measure) = 余計 (uncalled-for)

mnemonic: The excess water overflowed the BOWL, and painted the earth with its moisture

kunyomi.meaning: to paint, or to smear.Like foundation makeup. Or mud. (1/2 KANA)

mnemonic: If you can do lots of motion, you're On the way to Taking Off excess pounds. In other words, exercise!

jukugo.word: xxx 途中 で (xxx とちゅう で)
jukugo.meaning: on the way to XXX (I stopped and got some chips and a sody).
description: 途 (on the way) + 中 (middle) = 途中 (on the way)

mnemonic: The people of Gaytown voted to exclude the excess women, so they'd have more places to Jack Off.
description: The more hostile meaning is, to exclude, for instance: certain people.The more polite meaning is, to not count someone: "Not counting Bill, everyone here is republican."

mnemonic: When "corpse" has the extra line through it like this, I call that a "sunny corpse." So you can say:
Store the corpse in a place with a peaked roof, SO the sun can't get to it.

jukugo.meaning: means "warehouse," but also "storage" (as in the English phrase, "It's in storage.") 倉庫 is a stand-alone building - a warehouse or shack in back.
description: 倉 (storage) + 庫 (warehouse) = 倉庫 (storage)

mnemonic: The same guy to originated the concept of storage, also created the sword to guard it with.

jukugo.word: 創造的 な ( そうぞうてき な)
jukugo.meaning: creative (BOOBOO: don't confuse it with the OTHER そうぞう：想像, which means 'imagine.') (I know, it's pernicious!)
description: 創 (originate / creative) + 造 (produce) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 創造的 (creative)

jukugo.word: 創造性 ( そうぞうせい )
description: 創 (originate / creative) + 造 (produce) + 性 (sex / essential nature) = 創造性 (creativity)

jukugo.word: 独創的 な ( どくそうてき な)
jukugo.meaning: seminal or original - a new idea that was the basis for a trend. None of the bands you like are dokusouteki. They're all ripping off the dokusouteki artists. You poser
description: 独 (solitary) + 創 (originate / creative) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 独創的 (seminal)

mnemonic: I'm going to introduce you to mr. Kai, the KITE maker.
I know it's peaked roof plus '8', but you can think of this as an arrow pointing at the person you are introducing, a la the coveted "I'M WITH STUPID" shirt.

jukugo.word: ご 紹介 する (ご しょうかい する)
jukugo.meaning: introduce (someone or something to somebody else)
description: 紹 (aquaint) + 介 (introduce / intervene) = 紹介 (introduce )

jukugo.word: 自己紹介 ( じこしょうかい )
description: 自己 (One's own (as in, self-control, self-hate, self-help books, one's own discretion) ) + 紹介 (introduce (someone or something to somebody else)) = 自己紹介 (introduce yourself to a group.)

jukugo.word: 厄介 な ( やっかい な)
jukugo.meaning: troublesome, worrying. Hard to deal with! A hard-to-fix appliance. A stubborn, persnicketty person. (1/2 KANA)
description: 厄 (misfortune) + 介 (introduce / intervene) = 厄介 (hard to deal with)

jukugo.word: 介入 する ( かいにゅう する)
description: 介 (introduce / intervene) + 入 (put/go in) = 介入 (intervention)

mnemonic: Farmers used big KITEs, with their farm's name printed on the underside, to introduce their rice to the world!

jukugo.meaning: the world, as in "biggest in the world!" "fastest in the world!"
description: 世 (society) + 界 (the world) = 世界 (the world)

jukugo.word: 芸能界 ( げいのうかい )
description: 芸 (art) + 能 (talent) + 界 (the world) = 芸能界 (showbiz)

jukugo.meaning: means border or boundary of property (80% the same usage as さかい　（境） , but a bit more formal).
description: BOTH 境　and 境界　are often used in the figurative sense - like "This film pushes the envelope of good taste" or "His art blurs the boundary between painting and sculpture".
Also used in science.
境 (border) + 界 (the world) = 境界 (boundary)

jukugo.meaning: Suffix meaning, 'the world of XXX', as in 政界(せいかい) (the world of politics) or. . . . 芸能界 (げいのうかい) (the world of show biz)

mnemonic: You have a date tonight, so GO and find a Suit that suits you.
The peaked roof of the church suits Godzilla's mouth. Mmmm delicious!!
description: 合う gets the COCK because it's the #1 offender for NOKURI AND the #1 offender for KUN ON. Put another way: not only does it use the KUNyomi in the jukugo, but it doesn't even use the KUNyomi properly! It's usually pronounced 'あい', but the 'い' is not even written down.

kunyomi.meaning: to suit. The burlap sack suits your mama's hippo behind.

kunyomi.word: ( に　or と ) あ＊わせる
kunyomi.meaning: to unify. To bring different things together and make them fit. Like a band tuning up is called 音合わせ (making the notes fit).

jukugo.word: xxxの 場合 (xxxの ばあい )
description: 場 (place) + 合 (to suit) = 場合 (in the case of XXX)

jukugo.word: に or が 似合う (に or が にあう )
jukugo.meaning: those clothes look good on you.
description: 似 (resemble) + 合 (to suit) = 似合う (suit)

jukugo.meaning: a game (of pool, tennis, etc.) (KUN ON, NOKURI)
description: 試 (attempt to do) + 合 (to suit) = 試合 (game)

jukugo.word: 都合 xxx ( つごう xxx)
jukugo.meaning: at your convenience, xxx. （ i.e. with the new hack, we can break into their system at will). (since the Endangered Raver act has been repealed, we can harpoon 'em whenever we feel like it). (FP)
description: 都 (major city) + 合 (to suit) = 都合 (at your convinience)
組 (one's team) + 合 (to suit) = 組合 (a union or association)

jukugo.meaning: a big meeting or assembly of people - can be used for business meeting as well as fun meeting like a concert.
description: 集 (collect) + 合 (to suit) = 集合 ( big meeting)
割 (divide) + 合 (to suit) = 割合 (ratio)

jukugo.word: 都合がいい ( つごうがいい )
jukugo.meaning: located conveniently close to a place (FP)
description: 都 (major city) + 合 (to suit) = 都合がいい (convenient)

mnemonic: If you provide me with the string, I'll make a CUTE suit that suits you.
description: Sorry! The top 2 jukugo mean the same exact thing and are even 99% same-SOUNDING but you need both of them.

jukugo.word: 給料 ( きゅうりょう )
jukugo.meaning: wages - a bit more useful than the related word 給与. For instance, 'payday' is 給料日 (きゅうりょうび)、 not 給与日.
description: 給 (provide) + 料 (ingredients / fees) = 給料 (wages)

jukugo.word: 供給 ( きょうきゅう )
jukugo.meaning: to supply (supply and demand / supply the troops with guns / supply your kid with a school lunches / the feed chute supplies grain to the conveyor belt at the cereal factory)
description: 供 (accompany) + 給 (provide) = 供給 (supply)
給 (provide) + 与 (bestow) = 給与 (salary, wages )

mnemonic: Godzilla stubbed his TOE on a tower.
OK - a tower rises from the earth, with flowers growing from its peaked roof.

kunyomi.meaning: tower,pagoda (LAZY)

jukugo.meaning: SUFFIX - for example, エッフェル塔= Eiffel tower. (SUF)

mnemonic: Use your hand to pick up the SHOES which suit you

jukugo.word: 小学校 ( しょうがっこう )
description: 小 (small size) + 学校 (school) = 小学校 (elementary school)

description: 郊 (suburb) + 外 (outside) = 郊外 (suburb)

If you combine the strong points of various techniques, you will get the most effective style!

kunyomi.meaning: xxx is effective, most often said about medicine or drugs.

jukugo.word: 効果的 な ( こうかてき な)

something gets tightened or fastned.

SEND him to headquarters, he has a new assignment!

kunyomi.meaning: exclusively, entirely, nothing but

description: 専 (specialty) + 門 (gate) = 専門 (a specialty)
専 (specialty) + 攻 (attack) = 専攻 (major)

jukugo.meaning: someone is a specialist for XXX. In other words, they have a fetish for xxxx. Like デブ専 is a "fat person specialist" (SARC)

jukugo.word: 博物館 ( はくぶつかん )

description: 博 (museum　/extensive) + 物 (animal / thing) + 館 (big hall) = 博物館 (museum)

jukugo.meaning: a GIANT exposition. Not like, "Cezanne's greatest fuckin' paintings all up in here festival" but huger - like a World's Fair.

博覧会 (biggest　kind of expo )
展示会（てんじかい＝trade show)
展覧会 （てんらんかい＝art exhibition)
博 (museum　/extensive) + 覧 (view) + 会 (big meeting) = 博覧会 (exposition)

mnemonic: His specialty is tying up nuns with string.He ties their arms behind their BACK.

kunyomi.meaning: To bind something - to tie a string AROUND something - to shackle a prisoner, to tie up a masochist, to put one's hair in a pony tail (BOOBOO: to tie a knot is 結ぶ　（むすぶ））. (1/2 KANA)

jukugo.meaning: to restrain, to restrict, tie up in red tape.
description: 束 (bundle of sticks) + 縛 (tie up) = 束縛 (restrain)

mnemonic: This coffee is so weak I want to take a machete and HACK someone!!

to dilute or water down.

description: 演 (performance) + 歌 (sing) = 演歌 (enka)

kunyomi.meaning: to do a favor
to be blessed with xxx (good looks, a talent for dope rhymes, etc.)

jukugo.word: 悪知恵 のある or をつける ( わるぢえ のある or をつける)

This kanji is a drawing of a tnt plunger in a pit.

mnemonic: The MAN was full of pie.
Both flowers were full of rain- water.

jukugo.word: 満足 する ( まんぞく する)

jukugo.meaning: not what it sounds like! Houman means zatfig, voluptuous. This has two meanings： a) a borderline sexual-harassment word used generally about the big titty women. b) a a relatively polite way to describe a chubby woman. Anyway, ABU! (ABU)

mnemonic: Bruce LEE got divorced from Tommy LEE in 1985.

When two people get a divorce, the husband has to wear a beret.Then the wife draws a big "X" on his face, canceling him,Then she throws him into a pit with an angry moocow .While he is being chased around the by the cow, she gets with George Michael because she can't deal with straight guys anymore, And they ride off on the back of a giant turkey.
I don't know about your country, but this is the usual way it is done in Japan.

jukugo.word: 離婚 する ( りこん する)

it comes out

description: 引 (pull) + 出 (pull out / hand over) = 引き出し (drawer)

meaning: yield, get out of the way

I mean, it was not a good time to be alive, people.

There are expressions like "watch what you say!" that use 言葉 this way: 言葉使い が丁寧 (her way of speaking is very polite!) or 言葉大切につかいましょう （let's be careful how we speak!) (FP)

mnemonic: OK, this mnemonic is a bit of a stretch: The right-side part of 喋 looks like 葉, which is a kanji in the word, 'word'=言葉.
so, if you buy THAT argument,then the mnemonic becomes really easy, like so:
When you speak, your mouth says words (言葉).

kunyomi.meaning: to talk (KANA)

description: 虫 (insizzect) + 歯 (tooth) = 虫歯 (cavity)

出 (pull out / hand over) + 歯 (tooth) = 出っ歯 (buckteeth; rabbit-lookin'-ass teeth.)

description: 高 (tall) + 齢 (stage of life) + 者 (professional) = 高齢者 (old person )

description: 洗 (wash) + 脳 (brain) = 洗脳 (brainwash)

description: Usually SOLO

kunyomi.meaning: chest / breasts

jukugo.word: 度胸 のある ( どうきょう のある)
jukugo.meaning: courageous (people usually just say 勇気（ゆうき）） (NP)
description: 度 (times) + 胸 (chest/breast) = 度胸 (courageous)

kunyomi.meaning: a worry
