kunyomi.meaning: arrow - never used by itself (see below!) (NUBI)

description: 弓 (bow) + 矢 (arrow) = 弓矢 (arrow )

mnemonic: as in, "I doubt that GEESE can do the Moonwalk. "
It's correct to shoot yo Mama's heel with an arrow if you doubt that she's telling the truth..

kunyomi.meaning: to doubt

jukugo.meaning: a doubt　（疑問がある＝ I have doubts about it.)
description: 疑 (doubt) + 問 (question, problem) = 疑問 (a doubt　)

jukugo.word: 容疑者 ( ようぎしゃ )
description: 容 (appearance) + 疑 (doubt) + 者 (professional) = 容疑者 (suspect)

mnemonic: You raise your hand up like, "Waaaait a minute, I doubt that you are real GEEse. Judging by your cardboard feathers and paste-on googly eyes, you are some motherfucking sham geese."
description: This one is different from fake (偽) :it doesn't mean counterfeit or phony. It means sham as in a practice test, or a mock trial, or the model home in ARRESTED DEVELOPMENT where all the fruit in the kitchen was plastic. In other words, 擬 means a sham that is a mock-up or a model - it's not meant to fool anyone.

jukugo.meaning: 擬態語 is a　very Japanese concept - a sound effect for something that doesn't make noise - usually emotional states. The only English example of 擬態語 I can think of is ' bling.' (1/2 KANA)

description: 擬 (sham) + 音 (sound) + 語 (language) = 擬音語 (Onomatopoeia!)

歯 (tooth) + 医者 (doctor ) = 歯医者 (dentist)

description: 医 (doctor) + 療 (medical therapy) = 医療 (medical treatment)

mnemonic: Their whole family is BANDITS. (remember, bandit (賊) is also pronounced ZOKU)
I am so fucking fed up with my family, if I had a rifle or an arrow I would point it in their direction. Right at the Thanksgiving table.

jukugo.word: 商店街 ( しょうてんがい )
jukugo.meaning: shopping district. Not quite a mall, but a street with a tin roof, and all the shops are decorated similarly.Like all the stores on that street formed a kind of merchants' association and tried to give their street some atmosphere.
description: 商 (merchandise) + 店 (shop) + 街 (shopping district) = 商店街 (shopping district.)
街 (shopping district) + 道 (street) = 街道 (Highway)

mnemonic: Use your hand to hang the GUY's toe from the termite mound.
The termites will feast tonight! (the hand was made out of wood, and the guy was a pirate - it's a long story).

kunyomi.meaning: I hang something using a hook or pin. Also, to sprinkle something on something else (pepper, salt, etc.) Also means to drape over : drape a blanket over a sleeping child or put a tablecloth on the um uh table. Also means to turn on something electric, although how this is different from 使う is unclear!
something is hung

description: 手 (hand) + 掛 (hang / halfway done ) = 手掛り (a clue)

jukugo.word: xxx 掛け のYYY (xxx かけ のYYY)
jukugo.meaning: SUFFIX meaning halfway done. could be anything. a halfway-eaten cake, a halfway-drawn picture, a hal (KANA)

mnemonic: There's a GUY standing on a termite mound at the cliff's edge, ready to jump off into the water, and end his LIFETIME.

jukugo.meaning: lifetime (need a lifetime of counseling / for the rest of your life / cradle-to-grave healthcare / lifelong habit)
description: 生 (life / birth) + 涯 (lifetime) = 生涯 (lifetime)

mnemonic: Its FUCKED up how they sealed that HOE inside the termite mound with glue.

description: 封 (seal in) + 筒 (cylinder /pipe) = 封筒 (envelope)

jukugo.word: 封建主義 ( ほうけんしゅぎ )
description: 封 (seal in) + 建 (build) + 主義 (SUFFIX meaning 'ism'. As in capitalism, communism, materialism, and a Japanese grindcore band called 'intestine baalism.' ) = 封建主義 (feudalism)

mnemonic: Termite%20mound (termite mound) + Pi (pi)
description: delicious?

mnemonic: That continent is famous for termite pie !! If you get there, to go to the first pie shop in town and LICK all the pies.

jukugo.meaning: continent (ie. what your Mom is not)
description: 大 (big) + 陸 (continent) = 大陸 (continent )

jukugo.meaning: The Land Army (as opposed to navy or airforce)
description: 陸 (continent) + 軍 (army) = 陸軍 (The Land Army )

mnemonic: They SAY that if you eat a round termite pie you'll get strong powers.

kunyomi.meaning: most dictionaries/books/apps define this as POWER but it's more like momentum, (a power which is in motion). The power to influence something - like "The car had a lot of 勢い so it was hard to stop the car before we hit the cat." or "Because of the whiskey's 勢い, I could do a table dance in the White House."
JUKUGO:

kunyomi.word: ｐｏｓｔｕｒｅ　－　 posture, both literal and figurative. Unlike the related word 態度（たいど） one's 姿勢 is always intentional - something one consciously adopts.
kunyomi.meaning: 姿 (someone's shape, body, form) + 勢 (power) = 姿勢 (ｐｏｓｔｕｒｅ)
a large number of people - not in the sense of 'It's crowded today' but like 'There were crowds waiting to greet the Ambassador' - the crowd is united in its purpose.

mnemonic: You don't want to get a fever form mosquito bites so put NETS around your bed at night.
They lit a fire all around the termite pie until it was a hot thing.

kunyomi.meaning: a hot thing. Also can be used figuratively for hot emotions.
a fever. (LAZY)

jukugo.meaning: passionate! Although pretty far from how we'd use that word in english: the Japanese version means "dedicated , hardworking, diligent." 熱心な学生 (a passionate student) . . perhaps a better translation is simply 'enthusiastic.'
description: 情 (emotion) + 熱 (hot thing / fever) = 情熱 (enthusiastic)

jukugo.word: 熱心 な or 　に ( ねっしん な or 　に)
jukugo.meaning: passion - usually used about sports or performances: They praised the actor's passionate performance. She's passionate about her hobby.
description: 熱 (hot thing / fever) + 心 (heart) = 熱心 (passionate)
熱 (hot thing / fever) + 帯 (belt) = 熱帯 (tropics)

Diaper is a strange radical because sometimes it is a "big" radical, with other radicals inside it, and sometimes it turns into a "right-side" radical. Be warned!!!! Diapers come in all sizes! Diaper () is different from 'Moustache'() because both of diaper's sides bend outward at the bottom. If you still have trouble telling them apart, think "FULL DIAPERS BULGE OUTWARDS".

mnemonic: JOE Stalin told a vulgar joke about nuzzling a diaper with his Moustache. That dude was a riot. Whatever happened to him?

jukugo.meaning: a joke - you'll often hear: "冗談じゃない！” ('I'm not kidding!') (1/2 KANA)
description: 冗 (joke) + 談 (consult) = 冗談 (joke)

mnemonic: Your skin is like a diaper to keep blood leaking out of the body's organs.

kunyomi.meaning: refers to the skin of a person - not to leather or animal skin (BOOBOO)

description: 鳥 (bird) + 肌 (human skin) = 鳥肌 (goosebumps)

jukugo.word: 肌触り ( はだざわり )
jukugo.meaning: the texture of something (i.e. how it feels when rubbed on your skin)
description: 肌 (human skin) + 触 (touch) = 肌触り (texture)

mnemonic: I oppose COCAINE.
Put your hand up to oppose him laying his beret on top of your dirty cast-off diaper.

jukugo.word: 対抗 する ( たいこう する)
jukugo.meaning: to counter (used with two roughly equal things that oppose each other) (i.e. a counter-reaction, counter-demonstration, compete in the marketplace, counter-culture, antagonist, counter-balance)
description: 対 (against) + 抗 (oppose) = 対抗 (to counter )

jukugo.word: 抵抗 する ( ていこう する)
jukugo.meaning: to resist, used about one person taking on the whole fuckin' system, mannn!: draft resister, resisting arrest, La Resistance.
description: Also, to encounter resistance, resist temptation, and the electric concept of 'resistance' are also included in the meaning.
抵 (resist) + 抗 (oppose) = 抵抗 (resist)

jukugo.word: 反抗 する ( はんこう する)
jukugo.meaning: to be rebellious, defiant. To start a revolt. Unlike the related words 抵抗　（ていこう）　and 対抗　（たいこう）、　反抗 has the nuance of 'rebel for the fuck of it,' like a teenager would.
description: 反 (anti) + 抗 (oppose) = 反抗 (rebel)

mnemonic: I sit down at my wooden desk and write epic legends about diapers.

kunyomi.meaning: desk

onyomi: FUU - but half the time just FU.
mnemonic: The spooky wind made a sound like FUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU.
The wind blows a bug into your diaper. A bug??? Or is it. . . WU TANG KILLA BEE STYLE!!!!! That is a whole new kind of diaper rash right there.

kunyomi.meaning: wind

jukugo.meaning: bathrub. I mean tub. A bathtub. (1/2 KANA)
description: 風 (wind / the flu / style) + 呂 (washtub) = お風呂 (bathtub)
和 (peace/ Japan) + 風 (wind / the flu / style) = 和風 (Japanese-style)

jukugo.meaning: a common cold, the flu (FP, 1/2 KANA)
description: 風 (wind / the flu / style) + 邪 (heresy) = 風邪 (a common cold, the flu)

jukugo.meaning: SUFFIX that can go with a lot of words, meaning 'XXX - style.' (SUF)

mnemonic: Starvation is the KEY to being a successful model.
I'm starving so bad I could eat a diaper!

kunyomi.meaning: to starve (xxxにうえてる = metaphorically hungry for xxx (knowledge or power ,etc.))

mnemonic: You gotta dispose of each of the baby's diapers, otherwise you'll Smell His Odors 24/7.

jukugo.meaning: Often translated as 'management', 処理 is more like,"to take care of a problem. To resolve a complaint."
description: Unlike the related terms 経営(けいえい）　or 営む　（いとなむ）, 処理 is not a full-time job; more like something you do when an emergency happens.
処 (dispose of) + 理 (reason) = 処理 (take care of a problem.)
処 (dispose of) + 女 (woman) = 処女 (female virgin)

jukugo.word: 処分 する ( しょぶん する)
jukugo.meaning: to dispose of (unwanted stuff),punish, or deal with or manage (a problem)
description: 処 (dispose of) + 分 (understand / divide / minute) = 処分 (deal with/ dispose of)

jukugo.meaning: temporary, provisional management of a problem, until a lasting solution can be found : usually medical (i.e. stabalize the patient), but sometimes used about jury-rigging a machine. Take care of the radiation leak. Manage the PR crisis.
description: 処 (dispose of) + 置 (put down on table) = 処置 (temporary fix)

meaning: evidence which is the basis for a judgment
mnemonic: When the cops get their HANDS on you, Keep Your Opinions to yourself, and dispose of the evidence.

jukugo.meaning: physical evidence, such as a footprint, or "This green tap-water is evidence of pollution." Also this is the word one uses about evidence at trials, not 証. (FP, NP)
description: 証 (proof) + 拠 (evidence which is the basis for a judgment) = 証拠 (physical evidence)

jukugo.meaning: a grounds or basis for doing something. The authority to do something.
description: 根 (root) + 拠 (evidence which is the basis for a judgment) = 根拠 (grounds)

mnemonic: as in "You can get a BONer from even mediocre porn."
Let's call the single dot inside the diaper a tiny turd. OK? Great. Aaaand, all together now,:
A mediocre man walks around with a diaper with merely a single turd in it.

jukugo.word: 平凡 な ( へいぼん な)
jukugo.meaning: commonplace, ordinary, mediocre (i.e. rapping about rims)
description: 平 (equal / level) + 凡 (mediocre) = 平凡 (mediocre)

jukugo.meaning: an ordinary person, a common mediocre person.
description: 凡 (mediocre) + 人 (person) = 凡人 (ordinary person)

mnemonic: CHICKS like construction workers, especially when they whistle.
Use crafts to construct a mediocre house with bamboo and trees.

jukugo.word: 建築家 ( けんちくか )
description: 建築 (architecture. So help me God I'll never spell that word right.) + 家 (home) = 建築家 (architect)

jukugo.meaning: architecture. So help me God I'll never spell that word right.
description: 建 (build) + 築 (architect) = 建築 (architecture)

mnemonic: Today (今日, pronounced KYOU) fills me with dread. . . . it's my wedding day, to your stepdad
I dread the crafts made by people with mediocre hearts. P.Diddy, I'm looking at you.

kunyomi.meaning: to dread or really fear something.Basically the same as 怖がる but a little more formal.
scary

jukugo.word: 恐怖 する ( きょうふ する)
description: 恐 (dread) + 怖 (scary) = 恐怖 (super duper terror)

jukugo.word: 恐喝 する ( きょうかつ する)
jukugo.meaning: The legal term for blackmail or extortion. (NP)

mnemonic: Diaper (diaper) + 又 (again/crotch radical)
description: Imagine a lazy babysitter throwing a diaper at the baby's crotch. Stupid baby, do it yourself!

mnemonic: Use your hand to throw a ball at the umpire's TOE

kunyomi.meaning: throw

jukugo.word: 投票 する ( とうひょう する)
jukugo.meaning: to vote (also, it can mean election, as in "Did he win the vote?")
description: 投 (throw) + 票 (ballot) = 投票 (vote)

jukugo.word: 投書 する ( とうしょ する)
jukugo.meaning: contribute to a magazine - letter to the editor, purikura, etc.
description: 投 (throw) + 書 (write) = 投書 (contribute)

mnemonic: Your role is to go to the game and throw a ball at a YAK (FYI you are in the human/animal baseballympics)

kunyomi.meaning: a role. Use this about actors (役を演ずる： play a role!) Also used about businessmen who hold a certain post of position. That's right: post or position, not just role.

jukugo.word: 役に立つ ( やくにたつ )
jukugo.meaning: to be useful, to work like it's supposed to (used about things, not humans)
description: 役 (role) + 立 (stand up) = 役に立つ (to work like it's supposed to)

jukugo.meaning: role, but more general and figurative than just 役（やく）。 Gay dudes who are top or bottom - that's 役割。 If your role is 'the black sheep of the family," that's 役割。 The guy in the boy-band who is "the edgy one." The person on the reality -tv show who is "the crazy one."
description: The verb is 果たす（はたす）, as in XXX　の役割を果たす（ to play the role of XXX) (KUNKUN)
役 (role) + 割 (divide) = 役割 (role)

jukugo.meaning: a petty bureaucrat ass-grower like at the DMV. These are almost as unpopular in Japan as they are in the West, so maybe don't ask someone "Are you a 役人?" to their face. (ABU)
description: 役 (role) + 人 (person) = 役人 (beuracrat)

mnemonic: I SAID TO the coach, we should establish a baseball team so that we can throw balls at mitts.

kunyomi.meaning: to establish (a committee to look into the matter)（a political party), to found (a hospital or think tank) , provide (money) , or throw (a party for a valuable customer) . More broad and casual than the related term 設定（せってい）

jukugo.word: 設定 する ( せってい する)
jukugo.meaning: to establish a regulation or rule - also it is often seen on the 'setup' or 'preferences' menus of software when you install it.
description: 設 (establish) + 定 (plan) = 設定 (establish)

jukugo.meaning: an institution, some facilities. (a mental hospital / sports stadium / orphanage / water filtration plant)
description: 施 (put into practice / charity) + 設 (establish) = 施設 (institution / facilities)

mnemonic: I will throw the evil roBOTS down into the water!!

jukugo.word: 沈没 する ( ちんぼつ する)
description: 沈 (sink) + 没 (downfall) = 沈没 (sink.)

jukugo.word: 没 にする ( ぼつ にする)

mnemonic: I SAW TWO killers escape from the prison.
The killer threw the victim's body in a tree and left it there.

kunyomi.meaning: kill

description: 自 (my own) + 殺 (kill) = 自殺 (suicide)
殺 (kill) + 人 (person) = 殺人 (murderer)
暗 (dark) + 殺 (kill) = 暗殺 (assassination)

mnemonic: I say OHHHH shit!!! As you punch me so hard I'm thrown into the next ward.

kunyomi.meaning: punch

jukugo.word: 殴り合い ( なぐりあい )
description: 殴 (punch) + 合 (to suit) = 殴り合い (fistfight )

mnemonic: Two grrroins can make a KOdomo.
A man's grrroin is an organ that throws a milky white substance known as "Mommy Fertilizer."

kunyomi.meaning: crotch (BOOBOO: usually people say またのとこと)

jukugo.meaning: a comparatively polite way to say "crotch"
description: 股 (grrrrrroin) + 間 (a period of time) = 股間 (polite crotch)

mnemonic: When the soldiers charge, they really GET KEYed up!
The car charged up and hands came out the window, throwing spears.

kunyomi.meaning: to shoot a weapon

jukugo.word: 攻撃 する ( こうげき する)
description: 攻 (attack) + 撃 (charge) = 攻撃 (attack)

jukugo.meaning: 'real' shock (like electroshock therapy), or an emotional shock, or also just a physical impact (car crash)
description: 衝 (collision) + 撃 (charge) = 衝撃 (shock/impact)

mnemonic: 十 (ten) + 目 (eye)
description: Ten + eyes = the compound insect eyes of the fly!

mnemonic: I bought my shield in JUNE.
You need to stand behind the cliff to shield yourself from the onslaught of the fly. He has the strength of 20 men!!

kunyomi.meaning: shield

jukugo.meaning: contradiction / hypocrisy　 (interesting: the kanji literally mean 'spear plus shield'! Picture a guy claiming his shield is for self-defense, even as he holds a bloody spear in his other hand) . . ..
description: Japanese, tellingly, does not have a word for hypocrisy, so if you want to say hypocrite, you have to use this word (mujun) and try and make it fit.
矛 (halberd) + 盾 (shield) = 矛盾 (contradiction )

mnemonic: Blood goes from the heart to the shield and back, circulating. It helps the knight defend himself to have blood inside his body rather than outside of it.

jukugo.word: 悪循環 ( あくじゅんかん )
description: 悪 (bad) + 循環 (circulation - whether blood, air, whatever.) = 悪循環 (a vicious circle.)
循 (circulate) + 環 (environment) = 循環 (circulation )

mnemonic: The truth is, that the fly likes to eat on a SHINY pie.

(The pie is shiny because it is coated with the fly's glistening vomit. I'm not just being sick for the sake of sick here. Flies don't have a stomach, so they have to vomit acid on their food - digesting it OUTSIDE THEIR BODY, so to speak. Then they suck up the liquefied remains through their straw-like mouth-hole.)

kunyomi.meaning: PREFIX meaning,absolutely totally entirely XXX. usually used with colors.(まっかい、　まっしろい, etc). The words using this prefix always use the KUNyomi. (PRE)

jukugo.meaning: photo (take photo:　写真を取る （しゃしんをとる））
description: 写 (copy) + 真 (truth) = 写真 (photo)
真 (truth) + 実 (truth) = 真実 (the truth)
真 (truth) + 中 (middle) = 真ん中 (the very center)

jukugo.meaning: to bite someone's style, to impersonate (FP)
description: 真 (truth) + 似 (resemble) = 真似る (bite the style)

mnemonic: SHE refrained from speaking the truth in her heart.
description: FUCKED ROOTS ALERT -- whoever invented this kanji thought that it's prudent to refrain from speaking your heart.

kunyomi.meaning: to be cool-headed, prudent, or discreet when it comes to something potentially disruptive. Could also be translated as 'refrain', like, 'refrain from smoking or talking loudly.' 'Don't say fuck. Watch your lanauge when you talk to nuns.'

jukugo.word: 慎重 な ( しんちょう な)
description: 慎 (refrain / be prudent) + 重 (heavy / overlap) = 慎重 (discreet)

jukugo.word: 不謹慎 な ( ふきんしん な)
description: 不 (un) + 慎 (refrain / be prudent) = 不謹慎 (imprudent)

mnemonic: KENNY 's prefecture is the poor part of South Park.
A small loser, who's never seen anything outside of his home prefecture with his eyes.

jukugo.meaning: xxx - prefecture (Japan has prefectures instead of counties) (SUF)

jukugo.word: 県立 の ( けんりつ の)
description: 県 (prefecture) + 立 (stand up) = 県立 (prefectural)

mnemonic: I would bet my heart that we'll find the lost tribe in this prefecture!

kunyomi.meaning: literally, to hang or suspend something. But since usually Japanese use the 掛 kanji to mean hang, 懸 is more often used figuratively: meaning, to gamble or stake something. One's life, one's heart, one's money, etc.
it is hanging / it depends on xxx. Perhaps more accurately, "XXX is at stake."

jukugo.word: 一生懸命 ( いっしょうけんめい )
jukugo.meaning: to really bust ass and do one's utmost.
description: 一 (one) + 生 (life / birth) + 懸 (suspend / gamble) + 命 (life) = 一生懸命 (bust ass)

mnemonic: My hand directly smacks the fly because it's a loser. (and it vomited on my CHOCOlate) This fixed the problem of vomi-chocolate. Now I feel more JIGGY.
description: In jukugo, 直 tends to use CHOKU in words that have to do with direct contact, and JIKI in words which have to do with fixing things or being nice.

kunyomi.meaning: to fix / reform / correct a problem ( a broken chair, an inneficient beuraracrarcy, a poorly spelled word). Doesn't mean the thing was totally fucked up. Sometimes 直す just means do some minor alterations or revisions to make some shit perfect. Also means redo, as in かけ直して (phone me back).
it gets fixed

jukugo.word: 直接 の　or　に ( ちょくせつ の　or　に)
jukugo.meaning: directly (not just direct communication, but direct anything) (adjective form:直接的な）
description: 直 (correct a probem / direct contact) + 接 (directly contact) = 直接 (direct.)

jukugo.word: 正直 な ( しょうじき な)
jukugo.meaning: very honest person, very loyal. Person with integrity. Also means, "To tell you the truth. . . xxxx"
description: 正 (correct) + 直 (correct a probem / direct contact) = 正直 (honest / loyal)

jukugo.word: ｘｘｘ　と 仲直り する (ｘｘｘ　と なかなおり する)
jukugo.meaning: to make up　with XXX , to restore a friendship
description: 仲 (friendship) + 直 (correct a probem / direct contact) = 仲直り (to make up)

jukugo.word: 素直 な ( すなお な)
jukugo.meaning: obedient, gentle (kind of usually used in a sexist way to compliment a lady. I have a hat with sunao written on the front which always is good for nervous laughter.) (KUN ON)
description: 素 (element) + 直 (correct a probem / direct contact) = 素直 (obedient)

jukugo.word: 直前 に ( ちょくぜん に)
description: 直 (correct a probem / direct contact) + 前 (before) = 直前 (immediately before )

mnemonic: Put the stinky CHEESE directly down onto the net (the net will then be whisked out to sea by a pelican).

kunyomi.meaning: to put something down (put a pack of anchovies down on the bear's carcass) (that's not a mnemonic, BTW. That's just what I usually put down and where I usually put it).

jukugo.word: 位置 してる ( いち してる)
jukugo.meaning: be located at a certain spot (as in, the 7-11 is located north of the mountains but south of the sea)
description: 位 (rank) + 置 (put down on table) = 位置 (geographic location)

jukugo.meaning: temporary, provisional management of a problem, until a lasting solution can be found : usually medical (i.e. stabalize the patient), but sometimes used about jury-rigging a machine. Take care of the radiation leak. Manage the PR crisis.
description: 処 (dispose of) + 置 (put down on table) = 処置 (temporary fix)

jukugo.word: 放置 する ( ほうち する)
jukugo.meaning: to leave something alone. (similar to 怠る (neglect), but 放置 is value-neutral. 放置する just means "leave it as it is.")
description: 放 (release) + 置 (put down on table) = 放置 (leave it as-is!)

mnemonic: A CHEESE snob is a person who will only directly contact only the highest-ranked CHEESE.

kunyomi.meaning: price (NUBI)
a numerical value in a math or science sense. Angstroms. Light years. (not value like 'bad' or 'good')

description: 値 (price or ranking) + 段 (step / stairs) = 値段 (price)

jukugo.meaning: merit or worth - not used about money (it's worth it for the view! The good part of Dancehall is the bass!)
description: 価 (value) + 値 (price or ranking) = 価値 (merit)

jukugo.meaning: ｏｎｅ’ｓ　ｍｏｒａｌ　ｖａｌｕｅｓ - used with specific things, like drinking, smoking, gambling.
description: 価値 (merit or worth - not used about money (it's worth it for the view! The good part of Dancehall is the bass!)) + 観 (point of view) = 価値観 (ｍｏｒａｌ　ｖａｌｕｅｓ)

mnemonic: Trees and plants can fix a problem if you smoke them.

kunyomi.meaning: to plant a plant

description: 植 (plant) + 物 (animal / thing) = 植物 (plant)

jukugo.word: 移植 する ( いしょく する)
description: 移 (transfer) + 植 (plant) = 移植 (organ transplant)

mnemonic: It might SHOCK you to know how rabbits multiply.
Shhh!! I'm trying to correct a sexual problem and I need to concentrate.

jukugo.word: 生殖 する ( せいしょく する)
jukugo.meaning: reproduction, as in 'reproductive organs,' or 'the reproductive process' (NP)
description: 生 (life / birth) + 殖 (multiply) = 生殖 (reproduction)

jukugo.meaning: breeding. Unlike the related term 生殖 （せいしょく）、繁殖 refers to the entire process of finding a mate, not just the physical act of insemination: Breeding grounds. Mating season. Farmers breeding livestock.
description: 繁 (reproduction) + 殖 (multiply) = 繁殖 (breeding)

mnemonic: I'll BET TWO dollars that you and your boyfriend separate by next year.
If you don't shhh, I'll use my sword to separate your yapping mouth from your face!

kunyomi.meaning: to separate, like 'break up with', or like when you separate wheat from the chaff.

means 'especially' , but always used in the negative: そのゴハンは別においしくない。　（’this food is not really delicious.')(used by itself, as a short declaration, it's a good reply to anyone who asks you a dumb question) (SARC)
a different kind of thing

jukugo.word: 特別 な ( とくべつ な)

However - CONFUSINGLY - some jukugo - such as 'seahorse' and 'tornado' use this kunyomi (TATSU). . . .It's basically the reverse of how kun and on are usually used. (COCK)

For some reason, kanji using the comb radical tend to have a lot of elaborate nuances. Read on for the boring details!

mnemonic: I demand your Juicy Underwear!
My hair got wet in the rain and I demand to receive a comb.

jukugo.meaning: demand in the economic sense - supply and demand
description: This does NOT get to turn into a verb. You don't use する. You'd say 需要がある (there's a demand for xxx) or perhaps　　需要を　満たす　（じゅようをもたす） (there's enough of xxx to meet the demand). (NP)
需 (demand) + 要 (important) = 需要 (demand)

jukugo.word: 必需品 ( ひつじゅひん )
jukugo.meaning: necessities: both on everyday occasions and on adventures. Like if you're leaving the house you need your keitai and your keys! But also if you're going to the moon you need your ray gun and your moon bikini.
description: 必 (surely) + 需 (demand) + 品 (products) = 必需品 (necessities)

mnemonic: The masochist can withstand being TIED up.
The comb can withstand glue without becoming stuck in your hair!

kunyomi.meaning: withstand something physical - Fire resistant, or water-resistant. People, too: if you try to be a coal-miner and you can't take the physical labor then you 耐えらない。 (1/2 KANA)

jukugo.meaning: patience, forbearance -basically it is a more formal version of 我慢　（がまん）. However, 我慢 can be used in the active sense of "keep doing what you're doing, keep rolling that rock up the hill, don't quit." Whereas, 忍耐 has more a passive nuance - "Continue doing nothing, fight the urge to counter-attack or snap back." (NP)
description: 忍 (hide / endure) + 耐 (withstand) = 忍耐 (forbear, endure)

jukugo.word: 耐久性 ( たいきゅうせい )
description: 耐 (withstand) + 久 (been a long time) + 性 (sex / essential nature) = 耐久性 (durability)

mnemonic: His TAN is so deep he is on the edge of getting a melanoma.
Stand on the edge of the mountain and comb your hair (FYI you are super nonchalant)

kunyomi.meaning: edge (always literal, never figurative) (of your seat, edge of the plank) As opposed to 縁（fuchi) 、　端 usually refers to ONE POINT on the edge, the most extreme point (i.e. edge of the cliff, tip of the peninsula)

jukugo.word: 中途半端 な ( ちゅうとはんぱ な)
jukugo.meaning: this is an excellent phrase. It means, to do things halfway. Whether it's doing a half-ass job at your work, or taking a girl out on a date . . . .to burger king, or cleaning your room but only to the extent that your mom's turds are in a bag and not on the floor. - that's all CHUUTOHANPA.
description: 中 (middle) + 途 (on the way) + 半 (half) + 端 (the edge) = 中途半端 (half-assed job)

description: 極 (extreme) + 端 (the edge) = 極端 (extreme)

jukugo.word: xxxたと 端 にYYY (xxxたと にYYY)
jukugo.meaning: No sooner had I done XXX, when YYY happened. (where the た is the end of a past-tense verb: tabeta, nonda, hashitta, etc.)

jukugo.word: 尊敬 する ( そんけい する)
jukugo.meaning: to look up to or respect someone. (BOOBOO: it's not ok to tell someone directly, 'I 尊敬 you very much!' - you'd say it about a third party)

description: 警察 (police) + 署 (government office) = 警察署 (police station)

to shock or astonish motherfuckers

mnemonic: The CATS got thirsty in the sun and went sniffing for the scent of water. (Good luck with that.)

description: JERK； When used in a jukugo, it means "promise", but when used as a SUFFIX、it means "roughly speaking" . . . . although suffixes are always part of a jukugo, aren't they? So it is hard to tell the difference.

kunyomi.meaning: roughly speaking. Ish. 9yards約。 3 days約。 (SUF)

description: 約 (promise/ roughly speaking) + 束 (bundle of sticks) = 約束 (promise)
予 (beforehand) + 約 (promise/ roughly speaking) = 予約 (reservation)
婚 (marriage) + 約 (promise/ roughly speaking) = 婚約 (marriage engagement)
条 (clause) + 約 (promise/ roughly speaking) = 条約 (a treaty or pact)

mnemonic: My motivation is to fuck up my TEKI (teki =敵= enemy).
I promise that my motivation is only to catch white fish, not fish of color.

kunyomi.meaning: objective, target

jukugo.meaning: Mostly this is used as a SUFFIX which turns a noun into an adjective. Like how politics becomes 'political,' or how education becomes 'educational.' or economics becomes 'economical.' In Japanese, 政治　becomes　政治的な. (SUF)

description: 目 (eye) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 目的 (motive, not only for crimes.)

jukugo.word: 自動的 な ( じどうてき な)
description: 自 (my own) + 動 (movement) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 自動的 (automatic)

jukugo.word: 理想的 な ( りそうてき な)
description: 理 (reason) + 想 (idea/imagination) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 理想的 (ideal.)

jukugo.word: 基本的 な ( きほんてき な)
jukugo.meaning: the basics (the emphasis is: the minimum knowledge)
description: Also means fundamentally (emphasizing the essential bits that various things or ideas have in common)
基 (basis) + 本 (book / the real) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 基本的 (the basics)

jukugo.word: 合理的 な ( ごうりてき な)
jukugo.meaning: rational OR reasonable (i.e. get up at a reasonable hour or a reasonable compromise - like 'logical,' but used even if there is not a mathematical proof involved. Also has the nuance of efficient - the boss says to the worker 仕事合理的に進めなさい！　（しごと　ごうりてき　に　すすめ　なさい！）, meaning, 'Stop wasting our time and money! Work in a more efficient, rational way.'
description: 合 (to suit) + 理 (reason) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 合理的 (rational OR reasonable )

mnemonic: I promise I'll pay you gold for fish you catch.

kunyomi.meaning: the act of fishin' (n)
to fish (v)

mnemonic: Your KINfolk will never be more than average.
I promise that the ground is an average level -- stuff higher than the ground is tall, stuff lower than the ground is like a valley or a gorge or some shit.

jukugo.meaning: an average (adjective form: 平均的な）
description: 平 (equal / level) + 均 (average) = 平均 (an average)

jukugo.word: 均等 に ( きんとう に)
jukugo.meaning: uniform, even (both figurative and literal: level playing field, uniform lighting, equal opportunity) (に)
description: 均 (average) + 等 (equal /etc./plural) = 均等 (uniform, even)

mnemonic: Picture a plate with a brick of meatloaf on it, cut into slices.
description: 1,433 kanji into this book and we're still introducing new primaries!

kunyomi.meaning: plate

description: 灰 (ash/ gray) + 皿 (plate) = 灰皿 (ashtray)

mnemonic: I stole your plate, next time I'll come back and steal your TOES.

kunyomi.meaning: to steal - in a sneaky, burglar way

jukugo.word: 強盗 する ( ごうとう する)
jukugo.meaning: to steal in a violent, mugging kind of way. (FP)
description: 強 (burly) + 盗 (steal by stealth) = 強盗 (jack fools)

jukugo.meaning: take a sneak picture, usually of a woman dropping a deuce in a public restroom. Also known as 'ninjashotting.'
description: 盗 (steal by stealth) + 撮 (photo-shoot) = 盗撮 (hidden camera)

jukugo.word: 盗作 する ( とうさく する)
jukugo.meaning: plagiarism - biting of one's style by a sucker MC.
description: 盗 (steal by stealth) + 作 (make) = 盗作 (plagiarism )

mnemonic: The sun shining ON the plate full of water, made the water warm.

kunyomi.meaning: also abbreviated to あったかい: warm thing (puppy, or puddle under your bed )
I warm up (the muffins)
something gets warmed up

description: 温 (hot or warm thing) + 度 (times) = 温度 (temperature)

jukugo.meaning: hot spring baths (although most onsen use artificially heated water from regular wells these days)
description: 温 (hot or warm thing) + 泉 (spring) = 温泉 (hot spring bath)

mnemonic: I take an an oath to clean my plate until it's sparkley bright. But I MAY break the oath.

jukugo.meaning: an alliance, league, union (usually used with military alliances: NATO, UN Security Treaty nations, the Warsaw Pact alliance, etc.) (NP)
description: 同 (same) + 盟 (oath) = 同盟 (alliance)

jukugo.meaning: a federation : unlike the related terms 連合 (れんごう）　and 同盟　（どうめい）, 連盟 is made of individual people, not federated nations or gangs. れんめい is more like volunteers. Baseball clubs, Chess associations, the League of Women Voters, are 連盟。 (NP)
description: 連 (take with / inform of) + 盟 (oath) = 連盟 (a federation)

mnemonic: They SAY that when JOE Stalin first prospered, his dish was finally able to become full with heaps of food.

kunyomi.meaning: a heaping bowl of food / a raging fire / something overflowing with solids (but not liquids - that's a different kanji with the same pronunciation! 漏る！！！）
robust, active, overflowing with something-or-other : A flurry of applause, a fire vigorous enough to roast an ox, a flowering of culture.

jukugo.word: 盛り上がる ( もりあがる )
jukugo.meaning: to get exciting, to liven up.
description: 盛 (heaps of!) + 上 (above) = 盛り上がる (to liven up)

jukugo.word: 盛りマン ( もりまん )
jukugo.meaning: a bulging pudenda. Not like an average camel-toe. More like a set of labia that is thrusting out of a pair of tight pants like a she-boner.
description: Seriously, there's enough guys that are into this that they had to make up a word. Seems kind of a homo-erotic fetish to me.
But on the other hand, who says only guys should get to brag about the size of their units? (ABU, CCW)
盛 (heaps of!) + マ () = 盛りマン (bulging pudenda)

mnemonic: You dig salt out of the earth with the butt of your rifle,and put it on your plate, and then eat it with your mouth.

kunyomi.meaning: salt, motherfucker. Salt

mnemonic: Genghis KHAN used his one rifle to oversee the vassal's filling of the BOWL.

description: 監 (oversee) + 督 (supervisor) = 監督 (director)

jukugo.word: 監視 する ( かんし する)
jukugo.meaning: to supervise, or watch over a project. Also means, to guard bad people - guards at a prison, a teacher who watches students at test time to keep them from cheating. (BOOBOO: don't mix this with 警備 (けいび), which is someone who is guarding or protecting good people or things).
description: 監 (oversee) + 視 (peer at) = 監視 (to supervise)

mnemonic: The economist had an expert opinion on how to oversee money.
description: 23 strokes! This is the biggest, baddest kanji in the bunch.

jukugo.meaning: one's seal or stamp with one's name on it, which the Japanese use instead of signatures.
description: 印 (stamp) + 鑑 (expert opinion) = 印鑑 (chop / seal)

jukugo.meaning: a field guide; a book where each page has one picture and a description of a thing. (birds, gandams, monsters, doinks, whatever).
description: 図 (diagram/ map) + 鑑 (expert opinion) = 図鑑 (a field guide)

jukugo.meaning: to have a 'discriminating eye' for art. To appreciate art or music on some deep, expert level.
description: 鑑 (expert opinion) + 賞 (prize) = 鑑賞 (discriminating eye)

jukugo.meaning: expert opinion. Like an American Idol judge or art critic or some guy in court who says that tobacco does/does not cause cancer.
description: 鑑 (expert opinion) + 定 (plan) = 鑑定 (expert opinion)

mnemonic: A dot of blood on a plate looks like KETCHUP.

kunyomi.meaning: blood

jukugo.word: 血液型 ( けつえきがた )
description: 血 (blood) + 液 (liquid) + 型 (type / proper way) = 血液型 (blood type)

jukugo.word: 出血 する ( しゅっけつ する)
description: 出 (pull out / hand over) + 血 (blood) = 出血 (to bleed)

jukugo.word: 吸血鬼 ( きゅうけつき )
description: 吸 (suck) + 血 (blood) + 鬼 (demon) = 吸血鬼 (vampire)
鼻 (nose) + 血 (blood) = 鼻血 (nosebleed)

mnemonic: The hobbit populace all have the same blood. Because of the fur on their feet, they are un-chilly, so the hobbit populace doesn't need SHOES.

jukugo.meaning: general public - in the political sense. "This politician appeals to the general public." "Public sentiment is against the tax hike."
description: 大 (big) + 衆 (populace) = 大衆 (general public.)
To me it looks wide, flat, and covered with little pinchy arms.

mnemonic: The train station (駅= EKI ) turned a profit too.
Eric Cartmen turns a profit.

description: 利 (handy) + 益 (profit) = 利益 (profit)

jukugo.word: 有益 な ( ゆうえき な)
jukugo.meaning: useful or beneficial, (a policy beneficial to the State /it was a useful experience (a learning experience)) (NP)
description: 有 (exist) + 益 (profit) = 有益 (beneficial)

mnemonic: SOMEDAY (いつ) my profits will overflow my wallet like water.

kunyomi.meaning: overflow (also you can use it if you are a lady who is, um, - it's the femenine equivalent of 'boioioioioioingggg!')

mnemonic: YOyos have no honor. They are children's toys.
Talk to a crab about honor and, uh, and uh, and you will be surprised.

kunyomi.meaning: compliment - no, wait, fuck it. Most dictionaries list both 褒める　and 誉める as kanjis for 'compliment' but in practice only 褒める　is used. How's that for disambiguation?

jukugo.meaning: An honor or prestige that comes in the form of a seal of approval or bonus points from an authority figure. Usually used like this : 名誉なこと。 名誉を受けた。
description: 名 (name, famous) + 誉 (honor) = 名誉 (honor/prestige)

mnemonic: Keep Your Opinions to yourself until I ask you to cite or mention something.
Raise your hand to grab the crab. Yum!

kunyomi.meaning: To metaphorically bring up something (an objection, a point) to give an example of , to cite or mention something. But also - irritatingly - to literally raise one's hand (Oo! Oo! I know ! I know!) However, if you're raising anything else BUT your hand, you have to use 上げる instead of 挙げる. Yeah, I know, I know. What can you do?? (NP)
something gets cited or mentioned in a report or article.

jukugo.word: 選挙 する ( せんきょ する)
description: 選 (choose) + 挙 (raise / cite/ mention) = 選挙 (an election)

mnemonic: If you go on a boat, your SHOES will get the hell wet.
Think about it like a giant sail:

kunyomi.meaning: boat.
USED IN:
* 般

mnemonic: SEND for the caterer! I have eight mouths to feed on this here boat!
description: 9 times out of 10, when someone wants to say "boat" or "ship", they'll use this one instead of 舟.

kunyomi.meaning: ship

description: 風 (wind / the flu / style) + 船 (ship) = 風船 (balloon)

jukugo.word: 宇宙船 ( うちゅうせん )
description: 宇宙 (outer space) + 船 (ship) = 宇宙船 (space ship)

mnemonic: The captain has a problem with his COLON so he navigates the ship wearing nothing but a diaper and a beret. He doesn't have time to change pants every hour in these rough seas.

description: 航 (navigation) + 海 (ocean) = 航海 (nautical)
航 (navigation) + 法 (law) = 航法 (navigation)

mnemonic: HAN Solo is, in general, kind of a wise-ass.
In general, boats are thrown into the harbor, more often than thrown on land.

jukugo.word: 一般的 な ( いっぱんてき な)
jukugo.meaning: One of many many Japanese words for 'normal.' The nuance of いっぱんてき　is ordinary, non-special - as opposed to a member of a special group of people of things. 一般的な人 means, an average person. As in, 'an average person is not allowed in this Yakuza bar.'
description: 一般 (generally, commonly) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 一般的 (ordinary)

jukugo.word: 一般 に ( いっぱん に)
description: 一 (one) + 般 (general / overall) = 一般 (generally, commonly)

mnemonic: Let's BAN trays made of asbestos!
Generally, plates are put on trays in the cafeteria.
description: also means foundation or basis - makes sense if you think about a tray as the foundation for your lunch.

kunyomi.meaning: tray (LAZY)

description: 円 (yen/circle) + 盤 (tray / basis) = 円盤 (a UFO)
基 (basis) + 盤 (tray / basis) = 基盤 (the base or foundation)

mnemonic: MUTANTS:
catleft
He's MORE fierce than a , um, some kind of fierce guy.
The fierce cat ate the child on a plate.

jukugo.word: 猛烈 な ( もうれつ な)
description: Unlike the related word 強烈（きょうれつ）、　もうれつ is usually used about natural phenomena: a fierce storm; a violent wild-fire. The toboggan moving at a scary intense velocity downhill. Also can be used with emotions: A violent argument after someone got caught cheating.
猛 (fierce) + 烈 (violently intense) = 猛烈 (fierce )

jukugo.meaning: PREFIX, meaning fiercely XXX (i.e.　猛反対：fiercely against) (PRE)

mnemonic: Girls gone WILD is obscene.
The obscene cat ripped off your clothes and left you naked in the middle of the rice field.

jukugo.word: 卑猥 な ( ひわい な)
jukugo.meaning: old man slang. Nasty, dirty, obscene. Not always used in a bad way.
description: 卑 (despicable) + 猥 (obscene) = 卑猥 (obscene)

jukugo.word: 猥褻 な ( わいせつ な)
jukugo.meaning: gross, obscene. Always bad. A morbidly obese exhibitionist with genital warts. (ABU)

mnemonic: The cat ran across the earth to get far away from the monkey.

kunyomi.meaning: monkey (1/2 KANA)

jukugo.meaning: an expression which means, "Monkey see, monkey do!" (NEO)
description: 猿 (monkey) + 真 (truth) + 似 (resemble) = 猿真似 (Monkey see, monkey do!)

mnemonic: You track the prey you're hunting by Smelling His Odors.
You have to protect yourself if a cat is hunting you.

kunyomi.meaning: to hunt

mnemonic: KYOU (今日) is a good day to go nuts.
The cat's endless meyowing drove the king nuts

kunyomi.meaning: someone who is insane since childhood. Ted Bundy or whoever. They might seem normal at first.

jukugo.word: 露出狂 ( ろしゅつきょう )
description: 露 (outdoors, public) + 出 (pull out / hand over) + 狂 (go nuts) = 露出狂 (exhibitionist)

jukugo.word: が 発狂 する (が はっきょう する)
jukugo.meaning: As opposed to 狂ってる (born crazy), 発狂 is someone who is normally sane but had a breakdown from stress, or a sudden flip-out.
description: 発 (launch) + 狂 (go nuts) = 発狂 (mental breakdown)

mnemonic: The cat chased the solitary bug - it DON'T COOK the bug, though. . .it's a cat.

kunyomi.meaning: Alone. Unlike the other hitori (一人)、　独り has a sort of lonlely value judgement on it. Like, 'He lives by himself' or 'She had to do the whole thing herself (since no one would help her)' (1/2 KANA)

description: 独 (solitary) + 身 ((one's own) flesh) = 独身 (single, unmarried)

jukugo.word: 独り言 ( ひとりごと )
description: 独 (solitary) + 言 (say) = 独り言 (talking to yourself)

jukugo.word: 独特 な ( どくとく な)
jukugo.meaning: unique, or a quality particular to some thing or person

jukugo.word: 独立 する ( どくりつ する)
jukugo.meaning: autonomous - a colony becomes an independent country; a business start-up that is not under the umbrella of an established conglomerate, etc.
description: 独 (solitary) + 立 (stand up) = 独立 (autonomous)

mnemonic: GO COOK your flesh in a sizzling inferno.
The guy trapped between the viciously fighting cat and dog said, "OMG this is hellish!"

description: 地 (area) + 獄 (hell) = 地獄 (hell)

jukugo.word: 投獄 する ( とうごく する)
description: 投 (throw) + 獄 (hell) = 投獄 (throw someone in prison)

kunyomi.meaning: get or obtain :Unlike the OTHER える(得る ), 獲る is used for　 hunting - the predator obtains prey. Also sometimes used about sports victories.

jukugo.word: 獲得 する ( かくとく する)
jukugo.meaning: to obtain. Very similar to 獲る　（える） but 獲得 has the connotation of "obtain with great effort", or "FINALLY obtain." 獲る is more like, obtain something easy or small.
description: 獲 (prey on　/ get) + 得 (bargain　/ obtain) = 獲得 (acquire)
獲 (prey on　/ get) + 物 (animal / thing) = 獲物 (prey)

mnemonic: The two lines in the middle of the husband radical? Those are his arms! So we can say,
KYOU (今日) the husband adopted a hungry stray cat, who is very narrow, He gestures to his wife with his arms, 'It's THISSSS narrow!'

kunyomi.meaning: narrow or cramped (1/2 KANA)

description: It looks like the whorl of one's fingerprint, and generally means "proof of identity."In the west we use fingerprints, in the East they use little "chop" stamps with the family name on it.

mnemonic: HAN Solo also hella committed the crime of smuggling.
Fingerprint that cat before it can commit more crimes!!

kunyomi.meaning: commit or perpetrate - usually used with rape.

description: 犯 (commit a crime) + 人 (person) = 犯人 (criminal)

jukugo.meaning: anti-crime / crime-prevention (you tend to see this word on hidden cameras or locks a lot)
description: 防 (ward off) + 犯 (commit a crime) = 防犯 (anti-crime)

The capital "E" on eazy-E's stamp is like his fingerprint: a unique signature which signifies that he has notarized the documents.

jukugo.meaning: bitch-slap　someone right in the XXX. (KANA)

kunyomi.meaning: instead, all the more (better or worse) (KANA)

jukugo.word: 却下 する ( きゃっか する)
jukugo.meaning: Business Japanese: An upper person rejects,dismisses, or overrules a proposal made by an underling. (NP)

meaning: standard / the best way to do
mnemonic: It's standard for HAN Solo to have adventures involving swashbuckling.
The standard car of the year 2100 will be made of environmentally friendly bamboo and have a fingerprint sensor so only the registered owner can drive it.

jukugo.meaning: the extent, range scope, or bounds (extent of the earthquake-damaged area, scope of the congressional inquiry, range of the birds' migrations).
description: 範 (standard / the best way to do) + 囲 (surround) = 範囲 (extent, scope,)

jukugo.meaning: a model: Can be a person (a role model, a model sudent), or a thing (a model home, a model economy). (BOOBOO: Not model like a plastic model tank or gandam)

mnemonic: It is the honorable, correct thing to GO to the cops and give them your fingerprints. At least that's what they make foreigners do at the airport!

jukugo.meaning: two meanings - 1) cooked rice, 2) a meal (KANA)
description: 御 (the honorific "o") + 飯 (rice / meal) = 御飯 (rice)

jukugo.word: 御手洗い ( おてあらい )
description: 御 (the honorific "o") + 手 (hand) + 洗 (wash) = 御手洗い (toilet, man. Toilet!!!!!!!)

jukugo.word: 即興 の ( そっきょう の)

Bamboo grows immediately in this season!

jukugo.meaning: joint - like an elbow or knee joint , in a skeleton.
description: 関 (connected to) + 節 (season / joint) = 関節 (joint)

あや＊うい

kunyomi.meaning: 危 (dangerous) + 機 (machine) = 危機 (social crisis)

description: Cultural Code Word; According to Alex Kerr's seminal Japan-rant DOGS AND DEMONS, kids are assigned a kumi from the first day of school, and grow up thinking in terms of insider/outsider and be-like-everyone-else. . . even MORE than regular teens. They say Asians in general are more group-oriented than selfish Westerners, but the 'kumi system' is a specifically Japanese way of promoting group loyalty in a very rigid and some would say unthinking, ass-non-shaking way.

kunyomi.meaning: ditch, gutter, drain

jukugo.word: 排水溝 ( はいすいこう )
description: 排 (eliminate) + 水 (water) + 溝 (ditch) = 排水溝 (big ditch.)

rain falls

kunyomi.meaning: a year

半 (half) + 年 (year) = 半年 (half a year.)

jukugo.meaning: the year Black Sabbath released their first album.

description: 周 (circumference) + 年 (year) = 周年 (XXX-year anniversary)

kunyomi.meaning: 5 things (COUNTER)

kunyomi.meaning: to tell a story

jukugo.word: フランス語 ( ふらんすご )

jukugo.meaning: SUFFIX meaning "language of xxx-country" (for example, フランス語、ドイツ語） (SUF)

jukugo.meaning: a tale- often used in the title of a book or movie. As in 'the tale of genji' 'tale of two cities.' (KUNKUN, NOKURI)

description: 同 (same) + 音 (sound) + 異 (to differ) + 義 (righteousness) + 語 (language) = 同音異義語 (homonym)

mnemonic: Her heart Got Out of her mouth five times, that's when she knew she was enlightened.

kunyomi.meaning: to realize　（that someone is following you around / that someone is lying to you), or have a spiritual enlightenment (like Buddha)

description: Given that combination of radicals, what would YOU call it, Mr. Maturity??STRONG for "I"

Moving towards an orgy is different and wrong.

kunyomi.meaning: nuh-uh! Wrong! It's not like that at all!

description: 間 (a period of time) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 間違い (a mistake)

jukugo.word: 勘違い する ( かんちがい する)
jukugo.meaning: a misunderstanding - like the related term 誤解 , but 勘違い is a little smaller. If I'm reading and confuse one kanji with a similar looking kanji, that's 勘違い. But if I see my fiancee with her cousin from out of town, and assume she's having an affair and punch the guy, that's 誤解
description: 勘 (perception) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 勘違い (misunderstanding)

jukugo.meaning: (literally, 'different feeling') crazy - this is one of the biggest cusses in the whole language-a garunteed fight-starter. This is instructive in several ways.
description: 1) Japanese is such a polite language that 'different feeling' is one of the worst insults.
2) it takes a certain kind of culture to think that having a different feeling is such a bad thing in the first place!
3) Historically it is a discriminatory term against people who suffer from mental illness. (ABU)
気 (mood) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 気違い (fuckin' crazy)

jukugo.meaning: a somewhat formal word for difference (NP)
description: 相 (partner) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 相違 (a somewhat formal word for difference)

mnemonic: The person who organized this orgy was prestigious.

kunyomi.meaning: great, outstanding. As in 'a great painting' or 'a great show.'(p> It also means upper-class. Like 'We can't park in that parking spot - it's for erai people.' A regular doctor is not erai, but the head surgeon of the hospital is erai. That kind of thing.
(literally, "Prestigious, isn't he?") someone who thinks they're all that (SARC)

mnemonic: I have to go and defend the orgy from The Fonz (He's mad because he wasn't invited)

jukugo.meaning: self-defense - usually used in 自衛隊 (Japan's army, the Self-Defence Forces)
description: 自 (my own) + 衛 (defense) = 自衛 (self-defense)

衛 (defense) + 星 (star) = 衛星 (satellite)
護 (defend) + 衛 (defense) = 護衛 (a bodyguard, an escort)

mnemonic: 夕 (evening) + Fuckkk (fuck)

料 (ingredients / fees) + 金 (gold) = 料金 (a fee, also, bills.)

地 (area) + 図 (diagram/ map) = 地図 (map)

description: 地 (area) + 面 (front surface / face) = 地面 (ground)

A monk is a person who gets enlightenment

mnemonic: I suddenly tripped on my TOES and fell into the mouth of a cave, landing on an upturned fork. Ouch.
description: In China, this meant Tang Dynasty. The Japanese generally use it to mean 'sudden.' The only hint of its Chinese roots is the Japanese word for 'barbarian.' WTF??? I have no idea if this is also how Chinese use it or if that's just Japan making fun of the Tangs. Anyone out there know?

jukugo.word: 唐突 な or 　に ( とうとつ な or 　に)
jukugo.meaning: sudden AND unrelated to whatever came before it. Similar to 急に　 and 突然, but it emphasizes a random change, emphasizes that there is no cause-and-effect relationship. In other words, 唐突　is not just a sudden guy jumping out from behind a bush or a sudden thunderstorm. 唐突 is more like someone apropos of nothing changing the topic of conversation or getting mad for no apparent reason.
description: 唐 (suddenly) + 突 (thrust) = 唐突 (sudden, unexpected)
毛 (fur) + 唐 (suddenly) = 毛唐 (hairy barbarian!)

jukugo.word: 遠慮 する ( えんりょ する)
jukugo.meaning: CULTURAL CODE WORD in full effect. Meaning, it's such a uniquely Japanese concept there is no ready English equivalent.
description: 遠慮 means to be diplomatically, politely refuse, to regretfully decline.
For example, "You want the last donut?" "Hell yes!" is not 遠慮.
But, "No way I don't want it, it smells!" is also not 遠慮 .
"Thanks but I'm full now." is the 遠慮 answer, since it means, "We both know I want it, but since I abstained from it, you owe me one, now! The favor-ball is back in my court!"
Used most commonly in two situations：
1) 遠慮せず： meaning, 'Act casual. Eat the last pie. Don't wait for all the food to be served. Sit wherever. Make yourself at home.'
2) it's often seen on signs telling you not to do something: XXX遠慮してください。 ('Please refrain from doing XXX') (CCW, F)
遠 (far) + 慮 (consideration) = 遠慮 (regretfully decline or enjoin from)

jukugo.word: 配慮 する ( はいりょ する)

mnemonic: Q: on what basis do you believe Ice Cube is wack? On what grounds?
A :on the basis that he made "several" rhyme with "she-devil" and "apple" rhyme with "Snapple."

kunyomi.meaning: foundation or basis (the manga is based on the anime which was based on the videogame which was based on a true story) (NUBI)

jukugo.word: xxxに 基づいた (xxxに もとづいた )
基本的 な ( きほんてき な)
jukugo.meaning: the basics (the emphasis is: the minimum knowledge)
description: Also means fundamentally (emphasizing the essential bits that various things or ideas have in common)
基 (basis) + 本 (book / the real) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 基本的 (the basics)

jukugo.meaning: criterion - the basis for judging a sex partner, potential job applicant, which songs to buy, etc. Also - unlike the OTHER きじゅん （規準）、THIS きじゅん ALSO has a second meaning: 'standard', as in, standard wages, standard price, the gold standard, standard medical ethics. Metric is our standard of measurement in Japan, whereas in USA they use their own standard.
description: 基 (basis) + 準 (prepare / criteria) = 基準 (a standard )

mnemonic: That month was the period of time when we studied KEYS.

jukugo.word: に 期待 する or しよう (に きたい する or しよう)
jukugo.meaning: Expectations. For example, 今回は負けたけど、次に期待しよう！　（こんかいはまけたけど、つぎにきたいしよう！） We lost this time, but I expect we'll win next time!
description: Or, I expect that my students will give at least 33% effort.
期 (period of time) + 待 (wait) = 期待 (expectations)
学 (knowledge) + 期 (period of time) = 学期 (semester)

jukugo.meaning: period of time, usually several months. Or years. Precise, socially constructed time, not seasons or shit. 期間 is more like summer vacation. You are forbidden to enter Japan for a period of five years.
description: 期 (period of time) + 間 (a period of time) = 期間 (period of time)

jukugo.meaning: period of time - refers to a natural or social phenomenon : rainy season, the time that you can see fall leaves, the humid time of year.
description: 時 (time) + 期 (period of time) = 時期 (natural period of time)

mnemonic: You can dupe geese with this handy GEESE-call. just put it to your lips and BLOWWWWW!!!
That dupe had a lack of brains.

kunyomi.meaning: to dupe or swindle someone (1/2 KANA)

mnemonic: MC JIN(the most famous Chinese-American rapper) has enormous talent so maybe don't battle him if you are still rhyming "wack " with "crack."
That small animal has enormous nipples.
description: Although pronounced JIN, it's strong for KAN.

kunyomi.meaning: egregious (error), outrageous (impudence!), gross (negligence), ungodly (amount of sebum on the linoleum)

jukugo.word: 甚大 な ( じんだい な)
jukugo.meaning: ginormous, gigantic, fucking huge - almost always used about disasters. "The gigantic earthquake killed 1,000 dudes."
description: 甚 (enormous) + 大 (big) = 甚大 (fucking huge disaster)

mnemonic: People perceive Genghis KHAN as being enormous and strong. But he's actually really sensitive.

kunyomi.meaning: a hunch, as in 'かん が ある.' ('I have a hunch . . ') (LAZY)

jukugo.word: 勘違い する ( かんちがい する)
jukugo.meaning: a misunderstanding - like the related term 誤解 , but 勘違い is a little smaller. If I'm reading and confuse one kanji with a similar looking kanji, that's 勘違い. But if I see my fiancee with her cousin from out of town, and assume she's having an affair and punch the guy, that's 誤解
description: 勘 (perception) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 勘違い (misunderstanding)

jukugo.word: 勘弁 する ( かんべん する)
jukugo.meaning: forgive, tolerate, stand by and let a motherfucker get away with. (1/2 KANA)
description: 勘 (perception) + 弁 (dialect) = 勘弁 (tolerate)

mnemonic: Genghis KHAN can't tolerate the earth because it's too enormous. (he's kind of an agoraphobic)

kunyomi.meaning: tolerate, in a moral sense. Can't tolerate racism or "that kind of conduct."

description: It looks like a backwards "R", but it means "fang." Sorry- I really don't have a story. 自分で頑張ってください。

mnemonic: Is it heretical to worship satan in Germany? JA!!
In that town it is heresy to worship the fang.

jukugo.word: 邪魔 します ( じゃま します)
jukugo.meaning: to interrupt. Often heard in the phrase: おじゃまします!('May I come in?') Used with co-workers or friends who are busy. Not used when you go to a store or someone's house. (1/2 KANA)
description: 邪 (heresy) + 魔 (devil) = 邪魔 (interrupt)

jukugo.meaning: a common cold, the flu (FP, 1/2 KANA)
description: 風 (wind / the flu / style) + 邪 (heresy) = 風邪 (a common cold, the flu)

mnemonic: My good dog has my house-KEY already in his fangs all ready when I get home from work!

jukugo.word: 既 に ( すで に)

description: 既 (already) + 婚 (marriage) = 既婚 (already married)

jukugo.word: 既存 のXXX ( きぞん のXXX)
description: 既 (already) + 存 (be aware of) = 既存 (the existing XXX)

mnemonic: I GOT to have a turkey fang - it is the most elegant accessory of high society this season.

jukugo.word: 優雅 な ( ゆうが な)
description: 優 (kindhearted/excel) + 雅 (elegant) = 優雅 (refined)

mnemonic: Most GUYS already understand the general concept of trees. Even though they might not be able to explain photosynthesys in detail.

jukugo.word: 一概 に ( いちがい に)
jukugo.meaning: to make a sweeping generalization. (usually used in the negative: 一概には言えない (I don't want to generalize, but. . . ) )
description: 一 (one) + 概 (general concept) = 一概 (generalize)
概 (general concept) + 念 (concern) = 概念 (concept)

mnemonic: I deplore that GUY already, with all my heart!!!

description: 憤 (get indignant) + 慨 (deplore) = 憤慨 (resentment, burning slow anger.)

mnemonic: 市 (small city/dagger　radical)
description: OBSOLETE kanji which used to mean "barracks."I think of this as a dagger 〔市) so dull it has a bent blade. So let's call it "bent dagger."

mnemonic: The weather in JUNE is the epitome of spring.
Using string to try and mend a bent dagger is the epitome of stinginess.

jukugo.word: 純粋 な ( じゅんすい な)
jukugo.meaning: the essence of something. Pure pleasure! Pure blood! Pure honor!
description: 純 (epitome) + 粋 (essence) = 純粋 (essence)

jukugo.word: 単純 な ( たんじゅん な)
jukugo.meaning: the simple kind of X as opposed to the complicated kind (not rude). Also, simple-minded, mouth-breathing person (pretty rude).
description: 単 (merely) + 純 (epitome) = 単純 (simple version)

mnemonic: DON Quixote's spear got dull from stabbing windmills all day.
Your dagger is so dull it gets bent even trying to cut soft gold.

kunyomi.meaning: dull like not sharp (not dull as in dumb)

jukugo.word: 鈍感 な ( どんかん な)
description: 鈍 (dull) + 感 (feeling) = 鈍感 (dimwitted)

mnemonic: You'll note that the bent dagger radical is bent to the left, rather than the right. Because this kanji means opposite!
So now we can say . . .
Whichever way you move,I'll move the opposite !

kunyomi.meaning: to counter-react, to do the opposite of what you're supposed

jukugo.word: 逆 xxx ( ぎゃく xxx)
jukugo.meaning: this is a prefix, meaning "opposite of"- you can put it in front of any word, the way you'd use "Bizarrrro" (PRE)

jukugo.word: 逆さま のXXX ( さかさま のXXX)
逆効果 ( ぎゃくこうか )
jukugo.meaning: the opposite effect from what you'd intended.
description: 逆 (opposite) + 効果 (an effect) = 逆効果 (the opposite effect )

mnemonic: You could think of it as a boot (on the left) kicking a high-heeled SHOE (right) and sending the buckle of the hi-heel flying (top):
thus:
I compared my Dr. Martens to your $2,000 designer heel, and I won.

jukugo.meaning: other than xxx / except for xxx.
description: 以 (compared to) + 外 (outside) = 以外 (other than xxx)

jukugo.meaning: ２ meanings. usually said when you finish ordering something (food, copies, condoms) ； 'That'll be all.' It also means, "on top of all that" or "more than" (used like xxx以上、or sometimes also 以上　のｘｘｘ） (JERK)
description: 以 (compared to) + 上 (above) = 以上 (more than / that's all)
以 (compared to) + 前 (before) = 以前 (in the past)

mnemonic: If you'll compare that person to JESUS, you'll find a superficial resemblance. . . But he's just a dirty hippy.

kunyomi.word: ( が or に ) に*る
kunyomi.meaning: to resemble; to take after someone - usually used of parents and children, rather than 'Hey he looks like Afrika Bambatta!' Usually it is used in one of 2 idioms: すこしも にてない、 or よくにてる)

jukugo.word: に or が 似合う (に or が にあう )
jukugo.meaning: those clothes look good on you.
description: 似 (resemble) + 合 (to suit) = 似合う (suit)
物 (animal / thing) + 真 (truth) + 似 (resemble) = 物真似 (to impersonate)

jukugo.meaning: to bite someone's style, to impersonate (FP)
description: 真 (truth) + 似 (resemble) = 真似る (bite the style)

mnemonic: If you SHOW me the report, I will be told.
Think of this as 子 plus water 水, but half of water is on the left of child, and half on the right.
Thus:
As a child moses, was told not to part the bath-water.

kunyomi.meaning: (business - speak) What you say when you have heard an understood a proposal. Does not neccesairly mean you agree. Another example of Japanese deliberate ambiguity. (NP)

jukugo.word: 承知 する ( しょうち する)
jukugo.meaning: to agree in theory　(business - speak). Stronger than 承る（うけたまわる）.
description: 承知 is what you say when you have heard and understood a business proposal, and you agree with it. It doesn't necessarily mean that you will sign the contract or do whatever the person says; merely that you want to work together with them to accomplish these goals, in theory, after 100 more meetings. (F, CCW)
承 (to be told　/ consent) + 知 (know) = 承知 (to agree in theory)

mnemonic: I was told that JOE Stalin's flower only grows in a humid climate.

kunyomi.meaning: to be humid (BOOBOO:　90% of the time, people say "蒸暑い！” instead)
to cook with steam. Boring! No stars!

jukugo.word: 蒸し暑い ( むしあつい )
description: 蒸 (humid) + 暑 (hot place) = 蒸し暑い (humid)
. . .because it looks like the English letter "F" and plus "foolio" is fun to say. Plus, I already used "fuck"

mnemonic: Glen DANzig throws Foolio down a flight of stairs for making fun of Danzig's new-age synthesizer band,Black Aria .
description: And again some Spoonerized jukugo!
階 (story of a building) + 段 (step / stairs) = 階段 (stairway)
普 (normal) + 段 (step / stairs) = 普段 (under normal circumstances)

jukugo.meaning: a step in a process. A measure, as in "We're taking steps to reduce your mother's underarm emanations." Also a palindrome of stairway!
description: 段 (step / stairs) + 階 (story of a building) = 段階 (step/phase)

jukugo.word: 第二段 ( だいにだん )
jukugo.meaning: the second step (in a plan for world domination)
description: 第 (rank or number in series) + 二 (two) + 段 (step / stairs) = 第二段 (second step )

mnemonic: TODAY (今日) my COLON is really interesting!
Let's call that weird thing on the right side BIZARRO Foolio, because it's the same as regular Foolio but a mirror image.
Thus, we can say:
I'm interested in Foolio, but at the same time interested in BIZARRO Foolio.

jukugo.word: 興味 のある　・　がある ( きょうみ のある　・　がある)
description: 興味のあるｘｘｘ : an intriguing xxx
きょうみがある : I'm interested in it!
興味無し！ : I'm not interested!
興 (interest) + 味 (flavor) = 興味 (interest)

jukugo.word: 即興 の ( そっきょう の)
description: 即 (immediately) + 興 (interest) = 即興 (to improvise!)

mnemonic: On a sunny day, if I have the free time, me and Foolio go on a CAR ride. He's rapping with his mouth, and I'm grabbing my crotch.

kunyomi.meaning: free - not busy. People sometimes use this sarcastically, as if to say, "He has too much time on his hands." or "Get a life." 暇だね！ (1/2 KANA, SARC)

description: 暇 (free time) + 時 (time) = 暇時 (Free time)

mnemonic: Same ON-yomi as regular dragon (竜)
This looks difficult but it's easy: the left side is 'stand' (立) and the right side really looks like a dragon standing up on its hind legs, facing right!!
description: MEAN-A-LIKES:龍 - ancient Chinese dragon

mnemonic: An ancient Chinese dragon kicking you in the nuts with both SHOES? That is an onslaught, my friend.

kunyomi.meaning: attack

jukugo.word: 襲撃 する ( しゅうげき する)
jukugo.meaning: a raid. Like an assault done by a team of people, not just one mean guy. Usually used about the SWAT team raiding a house. But a gang can raid another gang. (NP)
description: 襲 (onslaught) + 撃 (charge) = 襲撃 (assault)
. . .because it is 3x the 'ku' katakana.

mnemonic: The KKK moves on patrol around here in June.

kunyomi.meaning: to travel around, or (metaphorically) to come round: the seasons rotate, leap year comes round once every four years.

description: 巡 (patrol) + 回 (rotate / times) = 巡回 (patrol)

jukugo.meaning: pilgrimage (in Japan, this means traveling a mountain road and visiting one temple after another, rather than going to one central holy shrine like Jerusalem or Mecca) (F)
description: 巡 (patrol) + 礼 (polite) = 巡礼 (pilgrimage)

mnemonic: You SIGH as 2 disasters strike your birthday party - KKK plus a fire.

kunyomi.meaning: a personal misfortune: house burned down, father had a stroke

jukugo.meaning: natural disaster - earthquake, fire, flood, your mother's flattus, etc.
description: 災 (disaster) + 害 (damage) = 災害 (natural disaster)

jukugo.meaning: a slightly more newspaper-ish word for a harmful blaze. (NP)
description: 火 (fire) + 災 (disaster) = 火災 (disaster fire)

jukugo.meaning: this means disaster - not in the sense of earthquakes or tsunami. Disaster in the sense of 'How was your trip to Tahiti?' 'Oh my god, it was a total disaster!!! First we missed the plane, then I got an infection, then on top of all that our hotel was run by zombies!'
description: 災難　carries the sense of a bunch of random unconnected misfortunes. It never rains, but it pours, kind of thing.
災 (disaster) + 難 (difficult) = 災難 (disaster)
No disrespect to the Wu Tang, but this kanji is not so useful.Why bother with it? Because you need this one for "apologize," which, this being Japan, is pretty useful.

mnemonic: You can make FIVE (五) mistakes, but then you are fired.
It's a mistake to say that the Wu Tang is something to fuck wit.

kunyomi.meaning: to make a mistake- Basically this is a more formal version of 間違える! Used by older folks instead of 間違える, but you can use it if you're talking about a miscalculation or if you took the wrong course of action/ a failed policy. (F)
a mistake (F)

jukugo.word: 誤解 する ( ごかい する)
jukugo.meaning: a misunderstanding- often used about situations (a la TV sitcoms) or when you misread someone's feelings.
description: 誤 (mistake) + 解 (solve / untie) = 誤解 (misunderstanding)
誤 (mistake) + 字 (letter) = 誤字 (tpo)

mnemonic: Women listen to the Wu for entertainment.

jukugo.meaning: entertainment like movies, comic books, Disneyland. . .
description: 娯 (entertainment) + 楽 (enjoy) = 娯楽 (entertainment)
I'm calling this radical "melon" because it's a very rare kanji for watermelon ( 西瓜）Plus it looks like a big "M"!

mnemonic: The isolated child sat in the corner eating watermelon.

description: 孤 (isolation) + 独 (solitary) = 孤独 (solitude)
孤 (isolation) + 立 (stand up) = 孤立 (isolation)
孤 (isolation) + 児 (baby) = 孤児 (orphan)

mnemonic: A KODOMO shoots a melon with her bow by calculating the arc of the arrow correctly.

kunyomi.meaning: an arc of a circle (LAZY)

jukugo.meaning: parenthesis, or anything shaped like a parenthesis

mnemonic: I do the deed of learning 2,000 kanji.
WHAT THE HELL is this shit??? It looks hella different from anything else, so it should be easy to remember.

kunyomi.meaning: for the sake of XXX (1/2 KANA)

jukugo.word: XXの 所為で (XXの せいで )
description: 所 (area / attribute) + 為 (deed) = 所為で (xxx's fault)

jukugo.meaning: one's behavior. Basically the same as 行動（こうどう）but a little more formal. Usually used in newspapers or discussions of trials. (NP)
description: 行 (go) + 為 (deed) = 行為 (deed)

mnemonic: A person did a bad deed : making counterfeit GEESE

kunyomi.meaning: a small deception, a white lie. Lying about your age. Lying on your resume (BOOBOO: not to be confused with the related terms 　だます(decieve to be mean)　 and　あざむく (criminal fraud)
PREFIX meaning, 'fake-' (PRE)

description: 偽 (fake) + 物 (animal / thing) = 偽物 (counterfeit)

jukugo.word: 偽装 する ( ぎそう する)
description: 偽 (fake) + 装 (dress up) = 偽装 (camouflage)
偽 (fake) + 造 (produce) = 偽造 (a forgery)

mnemonic: YOU dissolve one bug in your mouth.
description: Most of the words you can make using this kanji involve LITERAL fusion: atomic physics or chemistry. But unless you are a scientist as well as a genius at Japanese, most of the time you encounter this kanji, it'll be in a word about FIGURATIVE fusion: the co-mingling of money in the stock market.
金 (gold) + 融 (fusion) = 金融 (financing, financial.)

jukugo.word: 融通が利く ( ゆうずうがきく )
jukugo.meaning: someone who is accommodating of your needs. (FP)
description: 融 (fusion) + 通 (pass) + 利 (handy) = 融通が利く (accomodating)

jukugo.meaning: getting financing or funding or a business loan (usually in return for taking the banker and his friends from the Ministry of Finance out for some hostess action and $3,000 sake). (and possibly 'accidentally' losing a golf game or two) (NP)
description: 融 (fusion) + 資 (capital (as in $$$)) = 融資 (getting financing)

mnemonic: That town is a bunch of segregationist COCKS.

kunyomi.meaning: to partition, to separate: separate the class into "gifted" and "not gifted" students. Partition the room using folding screens. Divide the property between people. 5mずつ隔てて： every five feet (there's a pillar or fencepost).

jukugo.word: 隔離 する ( かくり する)
jukugo.meaning: to quarantine people - or 隔離背策：(かくりせさく)　an official policy to keep people in concentration camps, like USA did to Japanese-Americans during the war, or like Israel is doing in Palestine.
description: 隔 (segregate) + 離 (divorce / physical distance between things) = 隔離 (quarantine / put in internment camps)

jukugo.word: 隔週 xxx ( かくしゅう xxx)
description: 隔 (segregate) + 週 (week) = 隔週 (every other xxx)

jukugo.meaning: a small physical distance or gap - a literal space between two things: between two close-together buildings, say, or between the train and the platform.
description: 間 (a period of time) + 隔 (segregate) = 間隔 (small gap)

mnemonic: You SIGH when you realize you'll never have the skills to be a real MC.

description: 天 (heaven) + 才 (skill) = 天才 (genius)

jukugo.word: 才能 のある　/ のない ( さいのう のある　/ のない)
description: 才 (skill) + 能 (talent) = 才能 (talent)

mnemonic: JOE Stalin had a robust dictatorship going there for a while.

kunyomi.meaning: height; stature

jukugo.word: 大丈夫 ( だいじょうぶ )
jukugo.meaning: literally, 'No problem.' But, don't believe a Japanese if they say this. A salariman can get drunk, stumble into the street, get his legs cut off by a bus, and still claim to be 'daijoubu.' (CCW)
description: 大 (big) + 丈夫 (sturdy, firm,healthy) = 大丈夫 (No problem.)
丈 (robust) + 夫 (husband) = 丈夫 (sturdy, firm,healthy)

mnemonic: Do you worship Manowar's brand of hairy-chested, anthemic, self-referential metal? HAI!
hand (手)and some ridiculous totem-pole-looking thing I've never seen before.
so we can say. . .
Your praying hands worship the totem pole!

kunyomi.meaning: literally, to pray at a Shinto temple(BOOBOO: not used for Christians, Buddhists, etc.). Figuratively, to worship the ground someone walks on.

jukugo.meaning: polite way to begin a letter: "Dear Sir" (F)

jukugo.word: に 参拝 する (に さんぱい する)
jukugo.meaning: go to a temple to pray (NP)
description: 参 (admit defeat / visit) + 拝 (worship) = 参拝 (go to a temple to pray)

mnemonic: Two number 5s 五 , giving each other a reciprocal 69er!

jukugo.word: お互い にzzz ( おたがい にzzz)
相互的 の ( そうごうてき の)
description: 相 (partner) + 互 (reciprocal) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 相互的 (mutual, reciprocal.)

jukugo.word: 交互 に ( こうご に)
description: 交 (combine) + 互 (reciprocal) = 交互 (alternately)

mnemonic: BENDER IS GORGEOUS
Plus he's gonna zap you with a gorgeous RAYgun!

kunyomi.meaning: gorgeous, graceful. (NP)

jukugo.word: 綺麗 な ( きれい な)
jukugo.meaning: beautiful - (now you know why it is a 'na-adjective'　despite ending in い: it was actually a jukugo in the past!)
description: (usually KANA, so just two stars) (KANA)
